671358103.name: Stunning
671358103.author: a TripAdvisor user
671358103.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning place, some of the cleanest and warmest water you will find,\nand the sunsets are really special, nice little shack serving mojito,s, what could be\nbetter.

670102565.name: Fabulous at night!
670102565.author: a TripAdvisor user
670102565.reviewBody: Great place to sit and star-gaze in the evenings.  Also, you can see the bio-luminescent plankton in this location which is well worth the experience!

668740707.name: Pure natural beach
668740707.author: a TripAdvisor user
668740707.reviewBody: This is a natural beach.  It\'s not combed and cleaned like the resorts.  Please don\'t leave your trash behind.  Come here for a day to enjoy the beauty and solitude of this beach.  It\'s shallow and calm.  Bring a towel and grab a spot on the sand and take it all in.

664108312.name: Peaceful
664108312.author: a TripAdvisor user
664108312.reviewBody: We went twice and enjoyed the peaceful environment. They have some killer margaritas at the small bar!! WOW!! So good!! A few beach chairs avail for rent as well. Also a guy making burgers and hot dogs. The burgers were really tasty, but kinda pricey at 120 pesos.

662398035.name: Private place.
662398035.author: a TripAdvisor user
662398035.reviewBody: feels most like your own private beach than a public beach. Good experience and take some water and fresh fruit and stay all day.

659389703.name: Oh so peaceful
659389703.author: a TripAdvisor user
659389703.reviewBody: We rented bikes and rode out to this beach almost every day. it is beautiful and peaceful.. exquisite!

658366767.name: Nice place
658366767.author: a TripAdvisor user
658366767.reviewBody: When we visited Holbox for the first and second time in 2015 and 2016, Punta Coco was a quiet and peaceful place where you could find a very private spot on the beach to hang out on and enjoy the view and birds, fish etc. Now, there\'s a little bar and beach chairs and of course, more people. Just continue a little further down the beach and you have a little chance of finding a tiny spot for just yourself, specially if the tide is very low.

655074250.name: Perfect for sunset
655074250.author: a TripAdvisor user
655074250.reviewBody: Great beach but on the windy side of the island. It is perfect for sunset and has a long shallow entry great for kids and just wading in or sitting in a hammock above the water

653520330.name: Beautiful place and beautiful views
653520330.author: a TripAdvisor user
653520330.reviewBody: Very beautiful place to rest, enjoy, swimm and spend the day resting and swimming and enjoying the nature

652350686.name: Ruined by the Beach Club but Still a Beautiful Walk
652350686.author: a TripAdvisor user
652350686.reviewBody: This beach walk is wonderful as you will see diving Pelicans, Starfish and jumping fish. Unfortunately you have to manoeuvre your way through sunbathers at a beach club that has claimed the shoreline. Nevertheless, it remains a beautiful spot to walk to from Holbox.

651253105.name: Should be on the worlds best sunset list
651253105.author: a TripAdvisor user
651253105.reviewBody:
Words and my iPhone camera do not do it justice. Simply unreal. You can bike or take a golf cart there or rent a boat/sunset tour to get to it. 

We spotted an eagle nest on the way and another came in for a visit (2-3 meters from us) on the inlet. Simply paradise. 

Wear a lot of Mosquito repellent as they are voracious at sundown. 

There’s a cute little bar and hammocks if you care for a sunset drink in the water.

648052265.name: Sunset spot
648052265.author: a TripAdvisor user
648052265.reviewBody:
We walked from town (40 minutes) to catch the sunset (in mid January this is about 6.30pm). 
When we arrived there were quite a few people who appeared to have the same idea, all waiting with cameras at the ready.
Nothing particularly special about the sunset here that you wouldn't see on many other beaches, but if your in Holbox for a few nights it's something different to do, and the walk there and back builds up your appetite.
Remember to take insect repellent as you will get bitten on the walk back in the dusk.

645043248.name: Walk from beach to beach
645043248.author: a TripAdvisor user
645043248.reviewBody:
We walked from the holbox centre beach to the left and we had a great time. Not much people. Some swings and some hidden spots.

If you arrive at the beach there is a pier some hammocks in the water and some staff of the mini beach club.
 For rent are cannoes, and some beds.
Cocktails,beers, coco nuts are available.
With the taxi you are there in a minute or so.
For the toilet walk 3 minutes inland to the "fridas do punta Coco" a new bar/ restaurant.

Where you can eat some.

642825721.name: Quaint beach with a great sunset view
642825721.author: a TripAdvisor user
642825721.reviewBody: This beach is on the west end of Holbox Island where the sunset could be viewed in a quaint way.  There is no commercial transportation to that beach site other than private vehicles and taxis.  The beach is rough than the usual beach elsewhere on Holbox Island but there were beach loungers for us to use at no charge.  There were a small primitive bar and a coconut vendor on site.   Trademark Holbox hammocks in the water were available for us to lounge.  Pack your drinks and snacks and go to that beach for a gorgeous sunset view.  There is a hotel and a bar/restaurant one block away on the land where we got a taxi to go back to the centre.  Plenty of water birds were sighted nearby.

641944510.name: Beautiful untouched beach and nature
641944510.author: a TripAdvisor user
641944510.reviewBody: We went on a walk from town centre tk punta Coco, easily one morning. Loved it! Bring mosquito repellent as when you get close to anything green, mosquitos are ready to bite! Gorgeous beach and peaceful place. Amazing for sunset too and place to go to see the bioluminescence at night, but you need a taxi+guide to take you there

639445258.name: Lovely!
639445258.author: a TripAdvisor user
639445258.reviewBody: This is all one continuous stretch of a beach from one side of the island to this side, and it continues on. Punta Coco has nice calm waters, perfect for swimming, it is where the turtles lay their eggs and where baby turtles hatch. Awww!!!! Don\'t touch them tho! There are signs letting you know that they should be left alone, which is only logical. The Punta Coco is actually past the hotels and bars, it is at the very end of the street that passes through the center of the town and continues to this end. It\'s quiet and secluded and lovely. There is a bar on the street with lovely murals. It is not directly on the beach. Have fun! :)

639373246.name: Bit of a struggle, but worth it!
639373246.author: a TripAdvisor user
639373246.reviewBody: We rented a golf cart and drove west as far is it  would go. Then we hiked in and we were treated to a nice view west and a beautiful beach. The sand on Holbox is like flour and you can walk out quite a way. Nice spot worth the trip.

636373965.name: Secluded Beach with Water on Both Sides
636373965.author: a TripAdvisor user
636373965.reviewBody: It\'s a little bit of a hike to get to Punta Coco. Don\'t wear good shoes (they\'ll get muddy) or rent a bike (and expect to get muddy). Also, wear bug spray! But the western point of Isla Holbox has a stretch of sand where you have water on both sides of you \u2014 and it\'s a very quiet spot to spend a few hours.

635301259.name: Fun beach on Holbox
635301259.author: a TripAdvisor user
635301259.reviewBody: Fun beach. They have a bar, beach chairs, and hanging beds. Plus the in water hammocks are the best! A bit iff the beaten path but worth it.

627827090.name: Great beach and bike ride
627827090.author: a TripAdvisor user
627827090.reviewBody: My family and I biked to this beach as a storm was starting. It was amazing to watch. There is a great restaurant near the beach that makes the best drinks and shrimp ceviche ever!!

625900432.name: A walk.....but great to relax
625900432.author: a TripAdvisor user
625900432.reviewBody: The beach is clean, peaceful, never lots of people (been there a few times). Can take a small taxi there but I enjoy the walk, about half-hour from town.

617803869.name: Be sure to head left to the inlet area
617803869.author: a TripAdvisor user
617803869.reviewBody: The middle of where the inlet meets the ocean is divine. Crystal clear aqua water with flamingoes on the horizon!

616004560.name: Nice, quiet spot
616004560.author: a TripAdvisor user
616004560.reviewBody: A short cart ride west will get you to a quiet, shallow playground with a nice beach, dock, and hammocks over the water. Beautiful place!  Bring bug repellent as the mosquitos can be a bit much.

611954696.name: Stunning spot to swim, have a cocktail and watch the sun go down
611954696.author: a TripAdvisor user
611954696.reviewBody: We rented a golf cart and stumbled upon this beach whilst driving around. It is a stunning spot to swim, have a cocktail and watch the sun go down - definitely worth the 15 minute drive to get there. The hammocks over the water are a nice touch!

600008353.name: Must go if you are in Holbox
600008353.author: a TripAdvisor user
600008353.reviewBody: The have a beach bar, and hamacs for tourist to relax and take pictures. This is one of the attractions at this island, so you would see more people than other beaches in the island. Take a taxi golf cart or rent one. I wouldn\'t recommend to walk there if you have children.

599081939.name: Bioluminescence
599081939.author: a TripAdvisor user
599081939.reviewBody: We walked to Punta Cocos on our own. Our friendly hotel receptionist described the way and the beach is easy to find. Don\u2018t forget a good moskito repellent or you\u2018ll be eaten alive!!

598057300.name: Beutiful beach but plenty of mosquitos
598057300.author: a TripAdvisor user
598057300.reviewBody: Nice beach where you can walk into the sea for 500 ft and still don\'t get your swimming suit wet. Very calm waters and beautiful colors. The downside comes after 5 PM when mosquitos start to bother. Not too many shadows to cover from  the sun either. A small and modest bar provides drinks at reasonable prices.

591041145.name: Alternative
591041145.author: a TripAdvisor user
591041145.reviewBody:
Most people seem to go by bike or golf cart/taxi, and they are rightfully so. The distance is only about 2km- basically nothing, but you will pass through paddles(especially after a rain), and trails of mosquito hot spots.

Once you get there, it’s much calmer and less crowded than the main stretch. 

There’s one makeshift bar that serves drinks(and maybe snacks?) otherwise nothing. So pack your goodies and preferably go on some kind of wheels. 

Beach itself is not as shallow or sandy, but if you like more rustic feel this is it. 

There are some spots that really make you feel you are in a hidden gem.

585117791.name: Sunsets like no other
585117791.author: a TripAdvisor user
585117791.reviewBody: Come sunset time , everyone flocks to this point with the amazing unobstructed view of the red golden sun dipping into the ocean. Spectacular.

584027475.name: Beautiful Sunset
584027475.author: a TripAdvisor user
584027475.reviewBody:
We went there to see the bioluminescent, since it was new moon. Not familiar with the area, we went there before dark and watched beautiful sunset. 

But we didn't wait for it to be dark enough because the mosquitoes were brutal. Once it bit you, it wouldn't come off by shaking your legs/arms.

Sunset was about 7:15, we waited until 8 something. You can see few little lights spark as you wave the water on the surface. To see a lot of them, you have to wait for total darkness.

568305705.name: Simply beautiful beach
568305705.author: a TripAdvisor user
568305705.reviewBody:
This is a great beach area to go to. Not very crowded,
and nice and quiet. Walk the beach looking for shells,
just lay on the beach for awhile, or both. You can't go
wrong here on Punto Coco Beach.

566605541.name: Beautiful beach on the idyllic isla holbox
566605541.author: a TripAdvisor user
566605541.reviewBody: We decided to take a day trip from playa delay carmen to isla holbox. We drove and found plenty of parking at Chiquila- 100 pesos for 24 hours or 50 pesos for 12 hours- and then jumped on a 9 hermanos ferry to holbox. Once there we rented a golf cart for 4 hours- paid 600 pesos- and headed to punta coco. It\'s a nice quiet beach to have a relaxing swim. We then drove to las Nubes and walked on the sand dune to punts mosquito. The water in this region is much clearer and bluer than at punta coca and is full of horseshoe crabs. Then headed back to Chiquila on the holbox express. Was a truly fabulous day trip.\n\nAnyway- if you have a spare day and are sick of the tourism hype in Cancun or playa del carmen head for the beautiful remote beaches of isla holbox and simply relax.

566164256.name: Beautiful
566164256.author: a TripAdvisor user
566164256.reviewBody: A beautiful beach area.  We rented a golf cart and went out and glad we did.  Lots of chairs to rent if you want.  Just gorgeous.\n

560363789.name: Nice Beach
560363789.author: a TripAdvisor user
560363789.reviewBody: This beach is really nice and it\u2019s not packed with people. At night you can see the plankton glowing in the water and a lot of stars shinning. The water is not as green/blue but more like greenish swampy looking but still very beautiful. It\u2019s great for kids since there\u2019s no waves and the water is low.

559499765.name: Wonderful peaceful beach to visit
559499765.author: a TripAdvisor user
559499765.reviewBody: Great walk.  We went along the beach, a leisurely walk. Went in early morning, very few people along the way. \n\nWorth the walk!!

670099255.name: Speedy and value for money
670099255.author: a TripAdvisor user
670099255.reviewBody: Bags are loaded on separately - if you need yours urgently on the other side (particularly on the return to mainland Mexico) then I suggest waiting to get on last.  Smooth ride, I didn\'t get sea sick which was very unusual for me - locals sell snacks on board which is handy.

668761018.name: Holbox fast verry
668761018.author: a TripAdvisor user
668761018.reviewBody:
A very fast efficient and safe service. Great value for money at 85 pesos.
Fully air conditioned and a snack bar on board.
About 25 minutes crossing.

668742352.name: Hardworking staff
668742352.author: a TripAdvisor user
668742352.reviewBody: We used this service to and from the island.  I was impressed both ways with how quickly the staff of the boat got everyone\'s luggage off the boat after we all exited the boat.  These guys work hard and quick!  \n\nThe boat is nice and clean and the ride is smooth and quick.

667661440.name: Easy Access
667661440.author: a TripAdvisor user
667661440.reviewBody: Riding the ferry was great.  However, you cannot get from the airport to the ferry after about 11am.  If your flight is later you will have to spend the night in Cancun.  I would highly recommend the Salina hostel/hotel right next to the ADO bus station.  It was great and so close to catch the bus to the ferry.\nThe ferry ride was easy and fast.

666384494.name: Fast and affordable
666384494.author: a TripAdvisor user
666384494.reviewBody: The only way to get to the island is on this ferry which runs every 20 minutes or so. Nice ride over and back

664170307.name: Easy to use ferry
664170307.author: a TripAdvisor user
664170307.reviewBody: Only sensible way to get to the island (can fly to small airstrip not sure of cost but imagine not cheap). Only 150 pesos each cash only. You put suitcases at front of boat for loading and sit either in the cabin or on top. All very pleasant and chilled just gets you in the mood for arriving at Holbox Island takes about 20 mins \ud83d\udc4d\ud83d\udc4d\ud83d\udc4d

660545005.name: 9 Hermanos March 2019
660545005.author: a TripAdvisor user
660545005.reviewBody:
Recently, as it appears from the hand correction on the tickets, the cost was set to 150 MX$, just like the Express.
No credit cards accepted.
First you have to give your luggage to be loaded from the front of the boat & then you enter from the rear.
Basic comfort bench seats.
Left with 7 min delay & it took 40 min to berth.

656843361.name: Easy Access to Holbox
656843361.author: a TripAdvisor user
656843361.reviewBody: The ferry is quick and easy, the only issue might be there are no washrooms at the terminals.  It may be an issue after a 2 hour drive from the Cancun Airport, but the ferry does have basic washroom access.

655265854.name: easy, fast, on time
655265854.author: a TripAdvisor user
655265854.reviewBody: The staff will load and unload your luggage for you and the ride is pretty quick.The ferries are pretty basic and there are only a couple choices, but this one seemed a bit more upscale.

655081496.name: Easy, cheap, runs on time
655081496.author: a TripAdvisor user
655081496.reviewBody: This was a great way to get to Holbox. great service, easy to get tickets, leaves on a consistent schedule and on time, clean, comfortable.

653747009.name: Good service, but more expensive
653747009.author: a TripAdvisor user
653747009.reviewBody: The service itself is fine.  I would take 9 Hermanos instead as it basically the same service at 1/2 the price.

650137392.name: Easy transport
650137392.author: a TripAdvisor user
650137392.reviewBody: Runs frequently and on time!  Our bags were loaded on and off quickly and the trip was on time and very smooth

646204845.name: Great ride to Holbox
646204845.author: a TripAdvisor user
646204845.reviewBody: Loved the ferry to Holbox, but just be advised - you will get wet on the upper deck.  The staff takes your luggage on board and off again at your destination, great service.

641514632.name: Good.
641514632.author: a TripAdvisor user
641514632.reviewBody: Punctual service and helpful staff. Didn\'t have to ask for help with our cases because the staff are very hands on.

637215610.name: Holbox trip
637215610.author: a TripAdvisor user
637215610.reviewBody: Went on the holbox ferry .only took 25 minutes to come bk from the island .lots off seats on ferry very comfortable..and cheap to use

636373364.name: Fast (Ish) Ferry to Holbox
636373364.author: a TripAdvisor user
636373364.reviewBody: The ferry takes about 30 minutes to get to Holbox and starts out slow, but speeds up and gets a little splashy. If you sit outside, grab a seat in the middle unless you want to get wet!

634245890.name: Quick transfer from Chiquil\u00e1 to Holbox
634245890.author: a TripAdvisor user
634245890.reviewBody: 30 min transfer from Chiquil\u00e1 to Holbox. AC on the boat and well organised check-in and check out with the luggage.

630504085.name: Fast and Clean
630504085.author: a TripAdvisor user
630504085.reviewBody: Fast and clean service to go from Chiquila to Holbox Island.\nThe only problem was that they sell more tickets than the seats they have available.\nIt was raining a little bit and some people didn\'t have a seat during the transportation that takes about 25 minutes.

617447803.name: The best way to go to paradise
617447803.author: a TripAdvisor user
617447803.reviewBody: A beautiful ride to Holbox, you will enjoy the sea and the breeze during your 30 minutes travel to the island.

615743561.name: Two good choices
615743561.author: a TripAdvisor user
615743561.reviewBody: While it appears these two ferry lines "compete" for your business, they really don\'t.  Same price.  Same travel time.  One leaves on the hour the other on the half.

612347208.name: Fast and Convenient
612347208.author: a TripAdvisor user
612347208.reviewBody: This was my first time on a ferry and it was great since they had the option to go inside with the AC or on the top to get the breeze. Reasonable price and it made from one end to the other in 24 mins.

606919385.name: Great.
606919385.author: a TripAdvisor user
606919385.reviewBody: Fast clean boat that provides a friendly service. Good value for the service you receive. They also help with cases.

600008104.name: Good service
600008104.author: a TripAdvisor user
600008104.reviewBody: They depart to Holbox every 30 minutes. The ferry had air conditioner and it was clean. The staff was nice and polite.

599373639.name: Cheap service and clean boats
599373639.author: a TripAdvisor user
599373639.reviewBody: A very good option to get to Holbox Island.   Every hour you have a travel until 21:00 hrs.\nVery efficient personnel.

580289676.name: Staff on ferry steal from your luggage
580289676.author: a TripAdvisor user
580289676.reviewBody: I took the fast ferry today and the staff insist that you have to leave your luggage for them to load on and off ferry. Watch your stuff. While they sail the staff rummage through. Today my iPad was stolen during the sailing.

579113564.name: Same speed, nicer boat
579113564.author: a TripAdvisor user
579113564.reviewBody: We road on both brands of ferry - 9 Hermanos and Holbox Express. They both take the same time but Holbox express has a much nicer interior with better seats.

575419777.name: The best way to Holbox
575419777.author: a TripAdvisor user
575419777.reviewBody: You gotta take a boat to get to Holbox, may as well make it the Barcos Express.  It\'s the fastest, best air conditioned way to the island, reasonably priced too.

575235073.name: Hedges-Sanchez wedding at Xaloc
575235073.author: a TripAdvisor user
575235073.reviewBody: we used the Barcos Holbox Express to get to Cancun Airport we had a smooth ride with local people going to mainland going to work there were families it was a very nice experience !

574622464.name: Great reliable service
574622464.author: a TripAdvisor user
574622464.reviewBody: Good value, quick, reliable service. \nLooked to be safe seaworthy vessel.\nQuick 30min journey. Easy choice

569793959.name: Timely and abundant ferry service to Holbox
569793959.author: a TripAdvisor user
569793959.reviewBody: There is a ferry to take you from Chiquila to Isla Holbox...two actually, one red and one blue.  They are scheduled every half hour and tickets are available on site. Very affordable and comfortable 30 minute ride.

568100232.name: On time and fast.
568100232.author: a TripAdvisor user
568100232.reviewBody:
Well maintained fleet of boats, that are on time.
They handle your luggage for you, and do not 
expect a tip, but they were grateful when we did.
The music on the way to Holbox left something to
be desired. To loud, and neither of the two could
sing very well. They also expected you to tip for
their bad singing.

564337194.name: Looks like the Fleet is getting Updated
564337194.author: a TripAdvisor user
564337194.reviewBody: Quick and easy way to get back and forth between Isla Holbox and Chiquila. You buy your ticket to board and sail on the half hour in either direction. The trip takes about 25 minutes and the water is relatively calm. On board flat screen TVs give you a glimpse of the attractions available on the Isla as well as safety instructions.

559499508.name: Nice service
559499508.author: a TripAdvisor user
559499508.reviewBody: Good service, maintained boat. On time.  Handled luggage well.\n\nSat up top, got wet.  But that was all part of getting to the Island.

554657008.name: Great service.
554657008.author: a TripAdvisor user
554657008.reviewBody: Reliable service and punctual. Also the men are very helpful with the cases and didn\'t expect any tips although it is always nice to be nice.

553856705.name: efficient and great way to get to Holbox
553856705.author: a TripAdvisor user
553856705.reviewBody: A comfortable and clean ferry service that ran to time and stowed my luggage safely without the need to lug it on board. They take it on the wharf and keep it dry.

553036994.name: Good ferry.
553036994.author: a TripAdvisor user
553036994.reviewBody: We took the ferry from Chiqilla to Holbox and back. It cost 244 mxn and take 25 minutes. Its the red company. Also dont worry its a good ferry and almost don\'t make you sea seek.\n

548492940.name: Great Service
548492940.author: a TripAdvisor user
548492940.reviewBody: Great price, runs on schedule. Boats are well maintained and comfortable. I recommend riding on top if you are prone to sick sickness.

544615538.name: On time without any drama!
544615538.author: a TripAdvisor user
544615538.reviewBody: Have used them both trips to Holbox, never had an issue.  The trip is 30 minutes, and I recommend using the restroom before boarding - as there is no sign indicating that there is one on board..... I\'m sure that there is one.....

540804266.name: Great Service
540804266.author: a TripAdvisor user
540804266.reviewBody: Fair price, ran on schedule like clockwork.  Boats are well maintained and comfortable.  With the every half hour service neither of our trips were crowded.

649837464.name: NO flamingo!
649837464.author: a TripAdvisor user
649837464.reviewBody: Be aware : travel agencies sell tours around Holbox but it\'s not the season to see flamingo or to have good snorkeling!

641514972.name: Beautiful day.
641514972.author: a TripAdvisor user
641514972.reviewBody: We enjoyed our tour but found it over crowded but still a very nice day. Our guide made it so much more fun.

637174559.name: Well  Worth A Visit
637174559.author: a TripAdvisor user
637174559.reviewBody:
We visited Yum Balam whilst on a day tour to Holbox Island. Firstly we stopped at the jetty by the cenote and were given a short while to take a dip in the refreshing water. Our guide pointed out some interesting features and were fascinated by the abundance of wildlife especially the crabs in their holes! 
The cenote was quite busy with a lot of different tours but we still enjoyed it and managed to see a few fish in the water.
Next we went over to the "Passion Island" part of the reserve where the waters run so shallow and you can see the flamingos and other wading birds. This place is beautiful and certainly a place to take some magical pictures and create lovely memories.
The lookout tower is wonderful and you get an amazing overview of the area. 
Yum Balam was my favourite part of the whole Holbox trip and definitely would recommend to anyone visiting the area.

635306962.name: Epic
635306962.author: a TripAdvisor user
635306962.reviewBody: Review for VIP Tours Holbox: We met Willy with VIP at Pier Tibur\u00f3n Ballena in Holbox. Willy (our guide) and Christian (boat captain) were both beyond awesome. We had a private tour for our family of 4 - 2 adults, 2 children. Our boat sped ahead of the boat of 20 (25?) to get to Yalahau 1st. Yalahau is cenotes type freshwater lake. Crystal clear and very refreshing. Willy told us about the flora and fauna of the area. Jaguars and alligators are in the area. It was awesome. A must see.

631392404.name: what a gorgeous place !
631392404.author: a TripAdvisor user
631392404.reviewBody: Holbox itself is like the small villages of Mexico on the coast were probably like without giant hotels 40 years ago . Yum Balam is a well preserved part of this . Wonderful cenote , incredible birdlife

613958305.name: Breathtaking Outdoors Experience
613958305.author: a TripAdvisor user
613958305.reviewBody: My stay in Yum Balam was a breathtaking experience.  I explored mangrove forests, swam in a natural spring, and ate the freshest seafood.  Meaning I motor-boated over to the fishermen in the bay and purchased fresh catch from them. Rent is cheap in comparison to Los Angeles, so I got an apartment via AirBnB where I could feel safe (I was traveling alone), cook my own meals and be three blocks from the water.  There are NO road signs so the fact that my apartment was close to everything meant I couldn\'t get lost.  But the best part was seeing whole flocks of gorgeous coral-pink flamingos and finding sea turtle nests. That\'s the kind of wildlife most people will only ever get to see on the Discovery Channel. But I experienced it in person and I\'m coming back again next year!

582532544.name: Amazing beautiful nature!
582532544.author: a TripAdvisor user
582532544.reviewBody: This is an obligatory tour in the morning. Amazing views, quietness and raw nature as soon as you enter the Ecological Reserve of Yum Balam. You will be able to walk along kilometers of sand and shallow water on your left, virgin endless beach, and trees on your right. The landscapes will take away your breath. The most far you get, you will find more and more surprises: all kinds of birds, Horseshoe crabs, if you are lucky, you will see small sting rays, and of course colorful\u00a0 Flamingos (please: DO NOT APPROACH THEM. That could scare them and they leave the spot for good, causing lack of Flamingos the whole year, also when they get scared, they may break their legs while trying to fly in a rush, causing death for starvation in the end. Im not kidding.\u00a0 Do not try shooting selfies, just enjoy the view at a safe distance for them).\u00a0 Be aware of the hour: The earlier, the better. The tide comes back after midday. When I walked there at morning (9.30am), the water only covered my ankles, but when I went back, 4 hours later, the water between the sand bank and the beach line\u00a0 had already swelled up till my hips. \nSome people rent a guide and a boat ride (kayak) Others enjoy walking around. In my case,\u00a0 I recommend to use a bike. There are small bike paths along the beach. When you get well inside the ecological reserve, choose a spot (any) to start walking. It is so beautiful! \nTip: use long sleeves and pants you can get wet. If you dont have this clothes with you, the use biodegradable repellent. Mosquitoes are ferocious at any time!

580502361.name: Amazing colors and contrasts
580502361.author: a TripAdvisor user
580502361.reviewBody: The 7 different colors of the water makes an amazing experience. \nTry to rent a sailboat and not a boat to contribute to the environment. The lagoon isn\'t too big. If people start renting boats the lagoon will start getting dirty of fuel and its beauty won\'t last for a long time.

576311917.name: Reserva natural ( with Tui)
576311917.author: a TripAdvisor user
576311917.reviewBody: Tui trip to Holbox nature reserve was amazing, to see the flaming in its natural habitat as well as numerous other birds, there are actually more than 300 species for the serious birdwatcher! Hilaria was our super informed, chilled guide, really helpful and looked after everbody so well, making sure everybody had enough time in each place. Time to walk in the beautiful shallow blue sea and a wonderful boat trip to Holbox island to continue the tour on Golf buggies. All the colourful houses painted in graffiti art and eco hotels blending in with the precious surroundings. Two hours free time to explore or sunbathe at a beachfront hotel with lunch included. Return on the fast ferry.

571103605.name: Great unique swimming experience
571103605.author: a TripAdvisor user
571103605.reviewBody: A spring manantial in the middle of a gorgeous manglar 15 min in a boat from Holbox. Part of an excursion with fishing, ceviche (from what you fished) and visits to deserted islands (to eat the ceviche). It is known as the not-so-mythical Fountain of Youth, if my experience shows, it is true. Gorgeous, safe and thrilling experience. Do not miss it if you are in Holbox.

569794064.name: Preservation and Conservation on Holbox
569794064.author: a TripAdvisor user
569794064.reviewBody: Rent a golf cart and explore this conservation paradise. See wildlife and enjoy the solitude on your vacation.

562308535.name: Fantastic fresh water swim, 20 years younger!!!
562308535.author: a TripAdvisor user
562308535.reviewBody: Swimming in the lagoon is the fountain of Youth!!!  Private, secluded, FUN!!!  Once in a lifetime, can\'t wait to go again!!!

556725252.name: Lovely and refreshing.
556725252.author: a TripAdvisor user
556725252.reviewBody: Stopped off during our 3 island tour. Great place for a refreshing dip in the Cenote. Entertaining raccoons were a delight.

544614822.name: Varied and Special
544614822.author: a TripAdvisor user
544614822.reviewBody: Yum Balam is a combination of a protected wetlands and a national park.  It actually covers the Holbox island chain and surrounding waters.  There are a number of tours that can take you to the islands, and the areas around them.  Some of the things that can be done (in season) is swimming, snorkeling, diving, swimming with whale sharks, kayaking, kite-surfing, hiking, fishing, and birdwatching.

527922271.name: Great stop.
527922271.author: a TripAdvisor user
527922271.reviewBody: Unexpected stop on our way back to the hotel and it was an amazing experience to jump into the water in this scenic place.

525433650.name: So glad we did
525433650.author: a TripAdvisor user
525433650.reviewBody: We were on the island tour and the boat stopped for drinks and a dip for the brave. I\'m too old for all that now, but saw some amazing cat fish,  flamingos and scenery that was so gorgeous. So glad we did this.

525009076.name: Whale Shark Tour stop
525009076.author: a TripAdvisor user
525009076.reviewBody: Nice stop, served fresh ceviche, saw some birds and cat fish. Willy\' Whale Shark tours, Holbox Mexico. Great job guys.

520813928.name: nice place
520813928.author: a TripAdvisor user
520813928.reviewBody: arrived there through a tour. cold water but once you are in it felt great.\nthey take more money to go in in addition to the tour

512035042.name: Pink flamingos
512035042.author: a TripAdvisor user
512035042.reviewBody: Stopped here at the end of our whale shark swimming trip to round things up with a spot of freshly made ceviche and wildlife spotting! There is cat fish absolutely everywhere and the pink flamingos were delightful - I recommend a camera with a good zoom as you are prohibited from going remotely close enough to view properly (which i completely agree with)

490733264.name: Nice cool swim
490733264.author: a TripAdvisor user
490733264.reviewBody: We did the 3-island tour and stopped her in the middle of the day. Great place for a BBQ. We ordered local fresh fish and then went for a swim in the lagoon (cenote). By the time we got back, our fish was done. If you like fresh fish, this was the best.

483366723.name: Island Hopping and Yum Balam
483366723.author: a TripAdvisor user
483366723.reviewBody: While in Holbox, take half a day and do some island hopping; we really enjoyed that, althoogh our hope of seeing flocks of  Flamingos was dashed - there were only 2 to be seen at the end of February, but I understand that numbers fluctuate almost daily; the cenote was also very nice and clean, not to mention its stunning setting - highly recommended!

483255570.name: Beautiful clear water
483255570.author: a TripAdvisor user
483255570.reviewBody: Make sure you go on a tour that takes you here early or at an unusual time as then you get it to yourself. If too many people are swimming at once it makes the water cloudy.

473493174.name: A piece of paradise
473493174.author: a TripAdvisor user
473493174.reviewBody: Holbox is on the Yum Balam Reserve. The whole island has beautiful landscapes, birds  and vegetation. We had to wait two days to go on the classic three islands tour, Isla Pajaros, Yalahu and Isla Pasion, but it was worth it. Holbox is really a small piece of paradise.

456542568.name: Dirty and crowded
456542568.author: a TripAdvisor user
456542568.reviewBody: There were a lot of people in at once, and some of them were eating and drinking in the cenote which just made it all dirty.... a very uncomfortable experience

442452313.name: Nice outing to local highlights in the preserve.
442452313.author: a TripAdvisor user
442452313.reviewBody: The underground freshwater bubbling up into a swimming hole, climbing up wooden outlooks, raccoons, iguanas, etc. may seem mundane by US tourist standards, but the locals are very proud of this reserve, and the government has provided pier, boardwalk, and lookout points.  We went to Passion Island and Bird Island also (where hundreds (maybe thousands?) of birds land every evening)   It was a rare look into a portions of this huge reserve of flora and fauna that would never be allowed in the US.  We enjoyed our day!  (Mosquitoes can be an issue .. the guides know their jobs, they will tell you if you need more repellent or different clothing.)

676211830.name: Special place that was great for relaxing
676211830.author: a TripAdvisor user
676211830.reviewBody: We stayed on Holbox for a week and it was fantastic. The atmosphere on the island is very relaxing and the locals are very friendly. Highlights were exploring the island on bikes, the incredible sunsets, boot camps in the morning and relaxing on the many beaches.

676029281.name: We need to return to see more
676029281.author: a TripAdvisor user
676029281.reviewBody: We stayed at Hotel Puerto Holbox (outstanding staff, rooms, food and drink and the location was perfect for us), took the 3 island tour, and were having such a good time relaxing, exploring the beach and town that we didn\'t do half of what we could have in the 4 short days we were there. Clearly we need to return... looking forward to it!

675884616.name: clean and safe.
675884616.author: a TripAdvisor user
675884616.reviewBody: clean and safe but not much to do beside the everyday beach. if we went back we won\'t do more than 5 days.

675355689.name: Drifted Back in Time
675355689.author: a TripAdvisor user
675355689.reviewBody: My wife and I both have stressful jobs and getting away for a week is our reward for working hard. In recent years we\'ve traveled to larger all inclusive resorts but this time we wanted to go somewhere totally off the grid. We found it in Holbox, Mexico. My wife says it usually takes me a couple of days to unwind, relax and forget about work. In Holbox, away from everything, where the pace is slow and the scenery is beautiful, I started relaxing within a couple of hours of coming ashore. Holbox is a special place where time is measured between sunsets, not minutes and hours. Hurry and visit before everyone else discovers this beautiful place.

674815839.name: Most beautiful spot for a sunset!
674815839.author: a TripAdvisor user
674815839.reviewBody: Holbox is such a quiet, sandy town on the gulf of Mexico.  I\'m not a huge ocean fan so the calm, clear water was perfect for me!  There is actually a very long sandbar in the middle of the shallow water where you can relax and watch the sun melt into the sea with water all around you.  It was amazing! The shopping is quaint (and not over solicitous), the restaurants were good and inexpensive, and I recommend renting a golf cart to explore the island.  There are many boat excursions available and we will do that next time.

674758852.name: Excursion trip from Tui
674758852.author: a TripAdvisor user
674758852.reviewBody: Definitely was worth it to visit that Island , beautiful and laid back with gorgeous small hotels and the centre of the town is very colourful.

674661964.name: Heaven
674661964.author: a TripAdvisor user
674661964.reviewBody:
Don’t come for a day , stay for a week ! Totally rustic chilled out feel , I hardly put shoes on for a week ! 
A reel Caribbean feel ! Listen to the live music and watch the locals dance the night away , walk along the sandbar ankle deep in crystal clear  water while the pelicans dive in the sea all around. 
Unfortunately the popularity is growing faster than the infrastructure can so it can be a bit rough around the edges but that all adds to the charm . 
I only hope the government stops any more development now and just concentrated on upgrading the amenities for the locals and tourists alike .

674230288.name: Vacation
674230288.author: a TripAdvisor user
674230288.reviewBody: Nice place very remote prices reasonable \nAccess by ferry no transportation except \nBy golf cart taxi would prefer south of Cancun if the seaweed was not on the beaches

674186422.name: A paradise
674186422.author: a TripAdvisor user
674186422.reviewBody: We were starting to lose faith in how enjoyable our mexico trip was going to bw after Tulum but Holbox showed us that heaven exists. Everyone is super relaxed, the food is gorgeous, the beach is clean. Its to die for.

674028722.name: Idyllic island
674028722.author: a TripAdvisor user
674028722.reviewBody: We visited this island for a day and it is very beautiful. White powder sand, Sand roads, no cars just golf buggys. This is the place to wind down and really relax. Despite having cloud all day and thunder it was still lovely. There were hammocks on the sand and just a few hotels. They all looked pretty lush.

672813605.name: Heaven on Earth, paradise. Breathtaking. Safe, relaxed, fun.
672813605.author: a TripAdvisor user
672813605.reviewBody: Holbox is one of the most beautiful places I have visited, No cars, no paved streets, relaxed and chilled atmosphere. Really it is heaven on Earth. Great prices, hotels and restaurants. Amazing options for natural activities, like swimming with Whale Sharks. You can rent bikes for transportation, and taxis are golf carts. I fell in love with the island immediately.

672344014.name: Dreamy island
672344014.author: a TripAdvisor user
672344014.reviewBody:
You would actually think this was on the Caribbean coast but it's not......

It looks like it is, powdery white sand, turquoise sea, it actually reminded me quite like key west. 

We visited a few days ago and the beaches were completely unaffected by the seaweed, however I am not sure how long this will be for. I would suggest before you go do some research into it as holbox to tulum are due a shed load of seaweed over the summer which will be a complete shame. 

This place really is paradise. You can walk so far out to sea and only be at waist height, it's incredible. Hammocks in the water are su h a nice touch. 

Everyone seems very friendly here. So worth the day trip but I will definitely be back for more.

672234085.name: Great vacation in single
672234085.author: a TripAdvisor user
672234085.reviewBody: This is a great place to go if you want to get out of the all inclusive formula .This island is so charming and relaxing with the most beautiful sunset that i saw in my life ! I would definitly go back , no car , just golf car , and really calm !

671403486.name: Fantastic chilled island getaway-from-it-all wonder box
671403486.author: a TripAdvisor user
671403486.reviewBody: Shhhhhhhh! Don\'t tell anyone. This place is paradise. It\'s not actually Caribbean - it\'s Gulf of Mexico - but it\'s exactly what you think the Caribbean should be like at it\'s very best. Gorgeous. One note - there is 1 ATM, yes that is only ONE ATM, on the island that dispenses MNPs. And it\'s out of service more than in service. And whilst quite a lot of places take cards, you will definitely want to stock up with cash before you leave Cancun, or Valladolid or Merida or wherever before you set off for Holbox. You don\'t want to try to take your car to the island, so park it up in Chiquila before you get the passenger ferry - about 100MNP/day.

671166557.name: Paradise
671166557.author: a TripAdvisor user
671166557.reviewBody: This island really is a paradise, the beaches are stunning, we hired a golf cart which is a great way to get around, there was some areas away from the beach where there was quite a lot of rubbish built up, which is a shame, but away from that , stunning

671019057.name: Way fun in the sun, beach, water, pool and under palm trees. Perfect
671019057.author: a TripAdvisor user
671019057.reviewBody: Holbox is very comfortable and not to touristy.  You can find any level of accommodations, food and drink.  Beach, water and boating.  Our family had a blast.

671008392.name: Caribbean Dream
671008392.author: a TripAdvisor user
671008392.reviewBody:
Isla Holbox is slightly different from what we expected but it is definitely an amazing place to relax and live the Caribbean experience.

First of all, we were expecting a sandy island Maldives style, with no cars and no need for shoes. This is not the case. Yes, there are golf carts but sometimes they are bigger than the cars and there are dirt roads too with some cars (mostly from police or workers like aqueduct etc.).

That said, the island is truly beautiful. Pristine beaches, amazing nature and Caribbean architecture (wonderful colors all around). It’s like going back to the past and being in the present. In fact, while the roads are mostly dirt roads and most of the buildings are old, it’s easy to find a boutique hotel or a “fancy” restaurant, a gym or a laundry service, a bar or a fashion shop. 

They really care for the environment! In fact, in most of the places everything tends to be Bio and plastic free and the island nature is well respected.

We also saw the bioluminescence around Punta Coco under the stars! Extremely unique!

670900424.name: Lovely Island
670900424.author: a TripAdvisor user
670900424.reviewBody: Powdery white beaches, clear blue sea, lots of little nice restaurants and bar, was a little surprised by how much traffic the golf cars actually make -but easy to get to quiet places. Perfect place for relaxing days on the beach.

670099004.name: Chilled out vibe
670099004.author: a TripAdvisor user
670099004.reviewBody: Love the absence of cars - so nice to rent bicycles and see the island using pedal power! The beaches are particularly fabulous to the east, beautiful calm waters stretching out waist deep for miles.  Just magical!  Lots of places to eat and drink, for a variety of budgets.  Great for a four-day stay within a larger Mexico trip.

669569291.name: Very surprised how nice holbox was.
669569291.author: a TripAdvisor user
669569291.reviewBody: best holiday, best island in mexico and wonderful people with future in mind to keep the eco system safe for our children.

668755853.name: Pure paradise
668755853.author: a TripAdvisor user
668755853.reviewBody:
Where do I start, this island is probably the best in the world. With no cars and simply golf carts to get around, and hotels are all eco friendly.
It is somewhat unspoilt with sandy roads and beautiful beaches.
We did this trip with TUI and our guide Rob was first class, and absolute book of knowledge and with a great sense of humour.
Definitely value for money, includes a fast boat ride to 2 other islands on the way including Mosquito Island.
We encountered dolphins, flamingos and nesting Osprey along the way, and water is an amazing green where 2 oceans meet.
Brilliant day, but I hope they never spoil this beautiful paradise.

668740366.name: Wonderful island
668740366.author: a TripAdvisor user
668740366.reviewBody: We enjoyed this island and the people of this island so much!  It is so charming and wonderful.  If you enjoy nature and quiet, this is the place to go.  Things are nice and slow pace and relaxing.  Don\'t come here to change things.  Come here to enjoy the beauty of it and the wonderful local people.

666383935.name: Unspoiled beaches
666383935.author: a TripAdvisor user
666383935.reviewBody: This tiny island offers quaint and mostly affordable accommodations, some truly amazing restaurants and the cleanest beaches we have seen so far. No seaweed!

665737858.name: Super island
665737858.author: a TripAdvisor user
665737858.reviewBody: Heading down the long hot straight road to Chiquila with a beautiful island at the end. If arriving by car plenty of parking places in folk\u2019s yards charging 100 pesos for 24 hours. Then onto the 20 minute ferry ride that leaves every 30 mins. Island life awaits (it\u2019s a little bit dear, prices aimed squarely at tourists). Lots of restaurants. Beach in the main village is lovely but a bike ride / hike to Mosquito beach (don\u2019t let the name put you off!) presents an amazing sand bar. Sunsets in the north of the island. Highlight - swimming with iridescent plankton, an amazing out of the world experience. Come here to chill and then chill some more.

665328366.name: Chill out Island
665328366.author: a TripAdvisor user
665328366.reviewBody: If you want a place to relax in ......... this is the place to be....... so relaxing.  Its a car free island that uses golf buggies to get around- which can get a little noisy and the smell of petrol can be a bit overpowering other than that, the island is stunning.  The long white sandy beaches are out of this world.  There is a chilled out vibe around the island.\n\nWould recommend visiting even for the day if you haven\'t got the time to stay for a couple of days

664167354.name: Great Island
664167354.author: a TripAdvisor user
664167354.reviewBody: Decided on a TUI 2 Centre Holiday with Holbox as the first week. Having done some research it seemed a chilled place but when arrived it\'s definitely a shorts and flip flops place. Great Island just go with the flow and enjoy yourself. No Tarmac roads just sandy tracks where golf buggies are used. Lovely small hotels. Just go there and go with the laid back atmosphere a great place.

662501235.name: Laid back Mexican beach
662501235.author: a TripAdvisor user
662501235.reviewBody: Like the idea of a spring tropic beach bresk, but don\'t want to be around Spring Breakers? Don\'t like mass market resorts? Isla Holbox is a two-hour bus ride and a short ferry hop from Cancun, but well worth it. Minimally developed, no private cars, beautiful beaches with clear waters. Every thing from hostels to boutique hotels, but no \'resorts\'. Even if you\'re not staying in luxury on the beach, you can \'rent\' a lounge under a palapa on the beach at a  \'beach club\' for as long as you like by spending 500 pesos (about US$25) per person on food and drink. We spent a lot of time at Restaurante Villa Mar at the beach at the northern end of Calle Tiburon (the main street). Cold, cheap beer, good food (great shrimp ceviche), and outstanding beach and people-watching. Also recommend Barba Negra (aka Blackbeard\'s) for incredible tacos. Cafe del Mar has a great breakfast with homemade yogurt and granola. Try Tribu\'s rooftop in the evening for great food and eclectic (often live) music. Take Mexican cash. Not everyone accepts plastic and the ATMs sometimes run out of cash. The best ATM is in the police station on the SE corner of the Parque Centro.

662397789.name: Very nice place.
662397789.author: a TripAdvisor user
662397789.reviewBody: Calmness and safety in Mexico can\'t get better than in Holbox. We take home lot\'s of good memories and hope we can go back.

661233797.name: Honeymoon Haven
661233797.author: a TripAdvisor user
661233797.reviewBody: This is a must see if in Quintana Roo, Mexico. Filled with bohemian bars and rooftop restaurants and a smattering of boutique beachfront hotels it made the perfect stop over. The stunning beaches combined with whale spotting tours and trips to the islands to see the flamingos made this a perfect break from the mainland

661208870.name: Paradise Island,
661208870.author: a TripAdvisor user
661208870.reviewBody: This fantastic little island, located inthe north of the Yucatan Peninsula is a little gem ! On this small island no cars are allowed, no building higher than three-storey house, and you walk in your flip flop on the sandy roads. This is a must in mexico

660627074.name: ROMANTIC GETAWAY
660627074.author: a TripAdvisor user
660627074.reviewBody: this is one of my favorite spots in Mexico, is 2 hours away from Cancun and with 1 or 2 nights you can see the hole island

659674182.name: cute town
659674182.author: a TripAdvisor user
659674182.reviewBody: We went there on a tour. Beautiful beach. Very clean town. Not that many shops but the restaurant we ate at was good.

659345654.name: Amazing beach
659345654.author: a TripAdvisor user
659345654.reviewBody: Miles of soft sand and shallow water. Not taken over by hotels like Tulum. Small island so you can wander around on sand throughout

658897319.name: LOVE IT.
658897319.author: a TripAdvisor user
658897319.reviewBody: It should be called Paradise instead of Holbox. It is a paradise and for us it was an amazing experience to stay there. Love it.

658645853.name: We loved Holbox
658645853.author: a TripAdvisor user
658645853.reviewBody: We got engaged on Holbox, it\'s the perfect place for romance! Beach, tons of restaurants and a chilled vibe.

658379585.name: My home away from home
658379585.author: a TripAdvisor user
658379585.reviewBody: Me and my husband have visited Holbox in 2015, 2016 and 2019, and I see no reason for not going back again and again. Although not that quiet and serene as a couple of years ago, I still love this place. Tourists have certainly found this paradise but many of them seem to be there only for a day trip or some event like the annual carneval. There are some trips and we have done them all and also some water-related activities. Low tide gives you the most amazing and long beach and you can walk bare foot anywhere and admire the flora and fauna. My sole is at peace here. Great food and drinks can be found everywhere, the atmosphere is easy-going and laid back and if the Norte isn\'t around the weather is very warm and nice too. The sunset is uncredible.

657889209.name: Beautiful Island
657889209.author: a TripAdvisor user
657889209.reviewBody: A really chilled, soft-sand, gorgeous island to relax on and slow down. The vibe is great and is perfect after a tour of the Yucatan. All hotels and restaurants seemed great on average.

657551131.name: Amazing!! GO!!
657551131.author: a TripAdvisor user
657551131.reviewBody: We went on a TUI day trip to Holbox from our hotel in Cancun. Yes the transfer was long (2hrs) but boy was it worth it! \nWhat a beautiful place with some lovely bars and restaurants! \nI\u2019d go back and would recommend anyone to go!

657517659.name: TUI excursion
657517659.author: a TripAdvisor user
657517659.reviewBody: What a place, amazing beaches and wildlife. \nWent in a cramped mini bus for 2 hrs each way, mainly french, the guide was french so felt a tad intimidated, cramped in at the back with no view!! What a long 2 hrs! On the way back the rep insisted we sat at the front, so we had a view, but only spoke french all the way back, getting louder by the minute! Spoiled the trip for us, TUI should be better organised!!\nOther than that it was a great place, nice stops on the boat, spectacular views and great food, would have been nicer to relax on the beach for longer but it\u2019s a full day so. I extra time,( who stuck with 24hrs in a day!! Just not enough)

656883851.name: love it
656883851.author: a TripAdvisor user
656883851.reviewBody: is one of those dream places you need to visit. safe, beautiful, great food and drinks, not crowded by tourists, people are friendly, clean, and the best part they treat animals with respect.

656830215.name: Great for a few days
656830215.author: a TripAdvisor user
656830215.reviewBody: It needs to be said - this is a very small island (at least the populated part).  The people are lovely, there is a night life, food is great, but if you don\'t have great weather, there is very little else to do but eat and drink.  We were there in a cold spell (warm for the town, but the beach was cold and windy).  We enjoyed our time there, but 3 days was plenty without some time at the beaches.

655899179.name: Loved it!
655899179.author: a TripAdvisor user
655899179.reviewBody: The island is very laid back, the town is full of lovely stores, bars and restaurant and it has a great vibe. I loved it!

653562401.name: Not a quiet as promoted
653562401.author: a TripAdvisor user
653562401.reviewBody: A bit disappointing, the island is beautiful but do not expect quiet and no one on the beach unless you go far end in punta cocos in the morning (45 min walk). in couple of years it will be as busy as Tulum or Merida. That\'s a shame that\'s no one is controlling this better.

653520029.name: the beautiful island
653520029.author: a TripAdvisor user
653520029.reviewBody: This island has a beautiful beaches, , great food speccially fresh fish, very peacful,resting and walking or going in gol cars around the island, and you will have a great vacation

653051312.name: VERY SPECIAL.
653051312.author: a TripAdvisor user
653051312.reviewBody: Super special place and better than other tourist places in Mexico and looks safe and no problems on the streets.

650710382.name: BEST PLACE IN MEXICO
650710382.author: a TripAdvisor user
650710382.reviewBody: Beautiful island, incredible beach, very nice people, the vibe is so chill and the hotels are amazing!  loved every minut we spent there! Special mention for the sunset that are stunning and all the beach bars that serve delicious mezcal cocktails

650602515.name: Great Place to Unwind
650602515.author: a TripAdvisor user
650602515.reviewBody: We found Holbox to be quiet and restful during the day, fun in the evening with lots of options and very picturesque. We found the little town quaint but loved the fact that it maintains an individuality apart from tourism. Many fun restaurants and bars, spas at several hotels, massages in tents on the beach, boats and guides for hire and the ability to just lie quietly in the sun and read. You are definitely away from it all here!

650337490.name: what a weekend!
650337490.author: a TripAdvisor user
650337490.reviewBody: perhaps not for those looking for the bar scene, or clubs, or late nights, or any of the things that drive us out of Playa del Carmen and Cancun. Only 2,000 locals but many many travellers.It is a little piece of heaven.

648609468.name: The authentic Mexico.
648609468.author: a TripAdvisor user
648609468.reviewBody: To imagine how Holbox is, just imagine how the authentic Mexico would look like. A must visit island.

648552030.name: a lovely island being made less lovely by growth and lots of ATVs
648552030.author: a TripAdvisor user
648552030.reviewBody: We visited the island 20 years ago when it was a quiet place with few hotels and less restaurants and NO vehicles,.  now it is much more developed with many times the number of tourists and all the associated things that come with them, like ATVs that make lots of noise and much more of the island developed with little respect for what was there before.

647183291.name: Calm.
647183291.author: a TripAdvisor user
647183291.reviewBody: A very calm and undeveloped island. Basic but lovely and worth the visit. Perfect place to relax and unwind completely.

646142203.name: Great island!
646142203.author: a TripAdvisor user
646142203.reviewBody:
We traveled to Holbox because I wanted to kite and it looked idyllic on the pictures we found when we planned our holiday.
We traveled with our daughter 5months old.

Holbox is a beautiful island, with many great restaurants, both cheap and more expensive.
Best Curros ever you find at the night market.

Many activities to do, for me kitesurfing in a picture perfect lagoon with flat water was great!

Great beaches but very shallow so excellent for children to play.

It's a small island and we had planned to rent a golf car to get around, but the gold car taxi is cheap 50pesos from our hotel to centrum about a 10min drive. So we never felt need for our own car.
We also liked to walk, our hotel Villas Tiburon witch is one of the hotels farthest away from the centrum, only took us 20min to walk to the centrum.

The kitebeach is also located here just past Nubes hotel.

The island is easily accessible by ferry that runs every 30min it's a about 20min ride

A recommendation for everyone is to so a walk out on the sandbanks at semi lowtide it's the best, it's really a beautiful walk! 

Tip is to bring snack and water and strong sunscreen for the walk :)

645215148.name: Great little Sanctuary
645215148.author: a TripAdvisor user
645215148.reviewBody: The town has all you might need and is centered around the ferry/fishing docks. There is a small airport west of town center that is served by a couple carriers from Cancun. The island is uninhabited for the most part east of town and is a great park to explore! You get away from everything and can imagine what it must have been like just a few decades before. \nLots of good restaurants and a few grocery stores for supplies. Well worth a stay!

644157343.name: great place to get away
644157343.author: a TripAdvisor user
644157343.reviewBody: holbox island is a great getaway.  there is parking for your car in Chiquil\u00e1.  beware of parking at the first parking lot on the left when you arrive in the town.  the parking fee is 150 for all the lots.  but the first lot is NOT good.  there were THOUSANDS of ants on the ground.  it was so gross.  they went on my husband\'s backpack and he couldn\'t get them off.  the island was great.  you can walk everywhere.  the beach is gorgeous. the water is warm.  they have these hammocks right on the beach and anyone can go in them.

643795465.name: So beautiful, but a little sad
643795465.author: a TripAdvisor user
643795465.reviewBody: We loved Holbox. The beaches are just beautiful- white sand, blue green water, great sunsets, etc. The town is cute- there are lots of little interesting shops and restaurants. We found plenty to do while visiting for 4 days and 3 nights. However, I will echo some of the other reviews that noted Holbox is being overrun with tourist. The sewage system is an issue as is garbage. These issues will need to be address or the beauty of the island is in jeopardy.

642477692.name: In love with Holbox.
642477692.author: a TripAdvisor user
642477692.reviewBody: A must visit part of Mexico. If you have been everywhere else and thought they were great I guarantee you that this island will yet surpass your expectations.

642317941.name: (Still kind of) undiscovered spot, but not for long!
642317941.author: a TripAdvisor user
642317941.reviewBody: We came to Holbox Island as agroup of 11 (adults and teens) and had a real good time.  Althouh the season revolves around the arrival of the whale sharks (when I imagine it gets really busy), we were there for Xmas and it was quite busy as well.  Plan on spending time in long hikes, sun bathing or just relaxing.  The "tours" offered in the many, many kiosks that sell them are cheap enough but not worth the time if you planned other activities, since  the main attractions (whale sharks) are absent in December.  Horseback riding was fun.  Hotels are decent and offer pakages with breakfast included (worthed) and lunch/dinner included (not worthed,a as you want to explore the many other options available in town and at the hotels along the beach).  Overall we had a real good time, but if you are looking for great excursions and activities, go in the May/June period where you will have the opportunity to swim with the Whale Sharks.

641943330.name: My favourite beach destination in Mexico so far
641943330.author: a TripAdvisor user
641943330.reviewBody: On our holiday in Mexico we visited Cancun very briefly, Isla Holbox and Tulum and in my opinion, Isla Holbox is the best destination! Mostly because it is real, not like cancun which is totally spoiled by the massive hotel chains and doesn\'t even have a beach on that stretch that is accessible if you aren\'t staying at one of the mega expensive hotels. Holbox has a cute little town centre, with local shops and restaurants, no chains and local people living there! The beach is gorgeous and there is plenty to explore and do. Also amazing food, priced more reasonably than cancun and Tulum. The beach per se in Tulum is also amazing, but there is no town centre to go for a walk in the evening, they town develops on the highway. Much more of a community feel and welcoming atmosphere in Holbox!

641884455.name: Do your homework before you go!
641884455.author: a TripAdvisor user
641884455.reviewBody: Do not plan to vacation in Holbox unless you have already been there or have done your research very well. After reading all the great things about the place, we decided to check it out. Please keep in mind that this is only my opinion. I saw some tourists having a very good time. However, after spending several days at Isla Mujeres, Holbox was not that grand. First of all, I will share what I loved about the place. At night, the whole town\'s square becomes alive with both locals and tourists. There are several good restaurant and street stands. It is safe and very family friendly. The sea breeze adds a delightful touch to it as well. One of the nuisances that I encountered though, were the large pot holes in the middle of the dirt roads, which formed huge puddles, making it difficult to cross by foot. If you tried walking along the sides, sometimes the sidewalks were covered with trash and debris from local construction, making bypassing the puddles impossible. If you decide to head out to Punta Cocos, make sure you get a golf cart. I enjoy walking long distances, but the giant puddles and the scorching sun (I went in November) made the 4 PM walk very extenuating. Finally, what I really disliked, was the fact that there was not a single place to sit on the beach and have a picnic. All of the beachfront has been taken over by restaurants and hotels. Perhaps if I had walked further, I would have found something, but after a 15 minute walk I lost hope. My advice would be that if you decide to go, stay for a day or two, but don\'t plan your entire vacation around it. There is so much more Q. Roo has to offer to settle for this place.

641514568.name: Should be called "THE AMAZING ISLAND"!!!
641514568.author: a TripAdvisor user
641514568.reviewBody: Unforgettable, romantic and very safe. This is the true Mexico you want to visit. Have been to Cancun but this is by far better.

641074489.name: Intriguing and beguiling
641074489.author: a TripAdvisor user
641074489.reviewBody:
I felt like this place was a little like arriving at the last place on Earth. A 2 hour drive (longer by bus) from Cancun airport through predominantly unpopulated land to arrive at the little port of Chiquila. Another half hour on a ferry and voila’ you’ve arrived at the end of the road, with nowhere else to go and where you are presented with endless miles of exquisite fine white sand. In a good way it felt like a very long way from the hectic pace of city life in London.

This is paradise. But the thing about ‘paradise’ is for every great view there is almost always a pile of garbage or an eyesore just around the corner. The same is true of Holbox; there are a lot of great things here but there is also the customary fly tipped rubbish, scruffy scrub, abandoned half built structures and some building sites (progress must indeed progress even in paradise!). 

So that was first impression and I realised after a few days that the real beauty of Holbox is it’s virgin nature. There’s a lot to do in the natural world here - swimming with whale sharks, seeing dolphins, manta ray and turtles, manatee and flamingo and even crocodiles if you’re willing to brave the mangrove. There are great swathes of shallow limpid water that runs for kilometres, and you can walk in these shallows several hundred metres offshore to reach distant beaches like Punta Mosquito.

So, for me, that’s where the real beauty of Holbox lies. I found the little Holbox town a bit tatty and scruffy, but not in a particularly atmospheric way like other similar places I’ve visited. There are some stunningly painted shacks here and there but in between too many ugly concrete structures that lack similar atmosphere and charm. 

I think it would be wrong to come to Holbox expecting to find un untouched paradise. It’s been touched enough by human hands to not really be virgin anymore, but equally (in my opinion) not quite low developed enough to be truly charming. It’s sort of somewhere in between. 

So if you really want a sense of the virgin island you need to get away from the town. Town is too full of tourists and electric buggies to feel like paradise, but if you head out towards Punta Coco, Punta Mosquito or beyond you can get a greater sense of peace and a greater sense of somewhere untouched. 

We sadly hit very unsettled weather. El Norte, which brings cold sea temperatures, rain, unclear water and vast swathes of stinking sea weed. Until we arrived I’d never heard of El Norte but we discovered the season can last through December and through to January. When El Norte starts to blow it can be quite fierce, the sea is rough and beaches pretty much disappear with the sea swell. Where we stayed almost became an island with the amount of wash thrown up from the sea overnight. In summary we saw a broad spectrum of climatic conditions from total paradise serenity to strong winds with powerful waves crashing across land and turning boats and cabins over on the beach. Maybe not what we were hoping for but exciting nonetheless. 

I’ve been to many places in the Caribbean and there are a few that stick in my mind as being truly like paradise: Flamenco Beach in Culebra, Trunk Bay in St John and various tiny islands around Puerto Rico made my jaw drop. Holbox didn’t make my jaw drop and although the beaches along the main strip are nice I can’t say I found them particularly beautiful. There were a few too many ugly geotube break-waters and abandoned lumps of concrete that blight it. Even so there were two places that stuck out along the beach - these caught my attention because of how nice they looked externally, their attention to detail, their position on the beach, and the fact they made the effort to clean the seaweed away - Casa las Tortugas and La Palapa Beachfront Hotel. 

So would I go back, the acid test? I liked it, I enjoyed it, even the banged up little town started to grow on me. I just feel so much more could be done to increase the sense of charm here. I would hate to see it overdeveloped like Cancun but equally I can’t forgive the crappy abandoned structures that blight virgin territory. Even though I didn’t fall in love with it I was sad to leave and would have happily stayed for longer. So yes I probably would return, it felt like there were more things to discover, more facets to reveal themselves and paint a picture of an island perhaps more complex than it seems at first sight.

640961403.name: Overrated, overpriced, lots of trash, avoid.
640961403.author: a TripAdvisor user
640961403.reviewBody:
The island in itself is a natural paradise, no doubt. But what people made of it is a crying shame. An overpriced tourist destination with absolutely no interest for a sustainable development. 

A simple taxi ride in one of the golf carts costs 70 pesos. And then, there are only mud roads on the island. While ofc not having proper roads can be charming, it just shows you that none of the money from the overpriced hotel sector goes into infrastructure. There is a lot of trash on the island and owners of venues care exactly up to their doorstep about it.

There also is next to no genuine Mexican life on the island, everything seems to be spinning around tourism, which is usually a bad sign (see Cancun, Tulum etc.).

I'd avoid this place and go elsewhere.

638580215.name: great beach
638580215.author: a TripAdvisor user
638580215.reviewBody: nice and small beach ,when the weather is good the view just perfect but in our stay it was raining a lot and it was difficult to move in the island,need to check the weather before

638452751.name: Laid back beautiful island!
638452751.author: a TripAdvisor user
638452751.reviewBody: Beautiful beaches, yoga, birds, rich sea life and perfect weather.  Love this place!  So many restaurants to choose from and plenty of activities to make the stay interesting.

637491321.name: Paradisiac!
637491321.author: a TripAdvisor user
637491321.reviewBody: Holbox is as laid-back as you can imagine, pristine beaches, crystal clear water, beach bars that really deserve the name "beach bar"... a mix of young and seasoned travellers (back-packers with a credit card) make for a great ambiance. If you are into scuba diving or snorkelling there is plenty to see including whale sharks and manta rays.

637174259.name: Not Overly Impressed
637174259.author: a TripAdvisor user
637174259.reviewBody:
We visited Holbox on a day visit whilst staying at a resort on the Rivera Maya. The trip to Chiquila ferry port was long but we were excited about our visit to the Island via speed boat.
The first two stops at the cenote and "passion Island" were wonderful, full of nature and peacefulness with plenty to see and not too crowded with people, certainly the part of the tour that feels a little like paradise.
We then travelled to Holbox town and I get the feeling the locals aren't overly keen on tourists. It is a dirty and litter filled town and very smelly due to the knee high seaweed piled up on the beach all along it. We had a lunch with our tour guide and then had some free time to explore. We tried to get a couple of golf buggy's but the guy behind the desk decided to answer his phone half way through our coversation so after a couple of minutes we left him to it. We went to a bar and the drinks were good but the staff weren't happy that we were only drinking and not having food and made us feel like we couldn't stay for another, so we didn't.
It certainly isn't the dream island as billed, maybe it has been over used by tourists and been slightly ruined as there were lots and lots of people in such a small area and the locals can't seem to cope. 
I am glad I visited as the first two stops were lovely, just wish I could have given the town a miss.

636373826.name: Car-Free Island Escape in Mexico
636373826.author: a TripAdvisor user
636373826.reviewBody: It\'s kind of a trek\u2014from Cancun it\'s a 2-hour drive through the jungle and then a half-hour ferry ride\u2014to get to Isla Holbox (pronounced something like Ole-bosh), but it\'s totally worth it. There are no cars, just golf carts and bikes, and really only two directions to walk in. It\'s not luxe, but it\'s boutique, and still relatively undiscovered. The best thing I did was to make the trek out to see the flamingos near Punta Mosquito.

636195316.name: We went there again for the beach cleanup
636195316.author: a TripAdvisor user
636195316.reviewBody: It is the fourth time I go to Holbox, I\u2019ve only been there once as a tourist, three times for environmentally related issues. It is a beautiful place, but if the locals do not take care of it, it will soon stop being the gorgeous paradise that it still is. \nWhat is truly fantastic are the murals all over the place.

635583387.name: Beautiful but overburdened by tourism
635583387.author: a TripAdvisor user
635583387.reviewBody: Without doubt, Holbox Island is a beautiful place with great nature. However, I was there with mixed feelings. You don\'t need to be into conservation to observe that this island is overcrowded and overburdened by the tourism industry. The whale sharks have not come this year to the bay, there are piles and piles of up to 1,5 meters high of seaweed along all the coastline (and they\'re smelly), there is trash in many places of the island and in parts of the streets of the village seem to be permanently flooded. The island is a sandbank only and there is no good drainage system. More and more hotels are opening, also big international resorts. Noisy golf carts are racing around everywhere on the island. To me it seemed an ecological disaster, an island we are destroying as tourists. I wonder how long it will take before it really turns into a dump and hope for a big conservation programme for this island.

633885590.name: Nice laid back Island!
633885590.author: a TripAdvisor user
633885590.reviewBody: On this island you have a real island vibe. A must do is a visit to the animal shelter! Morelia has set up the animal shelter and works with an enthusiastic team of volunteers. Please help the animals and give a donation, you also make the dogs very happy to walk with them! \n\nThe shelter is located close to cafeteria "Le Jardin". Here you can enjoy very good breakfast.

631762396.name: Perfect getaway
631762396.author: a TripAdvisor user
631762396.reviewBody: Very relaxed place with nice beach, good restaurants and chill atmosphere (and not too many tourists) \ud83d\ude0a we spent here 4 nights, a very relaxing place to start a holiday. Come here if you wish a relaxing place with not too many activities.

631746433.name: Beautiful Island
631746433.author: a TripAdvisor user
631746433.reviewBody:
This island is a hidden gem, if planning a trip to Mexico this is a must see.

This island is full of beautiful white beaches & crystal clear waters. The sea at one point of the island is 4 different shades of blue. We visited here on a trip, we did part of the island via boat which was amazing and we got the chance to see flamingo’s and wild birds. To see the rest of the island we did this via a beach buggy, this gave you the chance to see the whole island. 

We stopped for lunch at a restaurant on the beach, sat in the swings & hammocks in the sea and visit the local shops to pick up some souvenirs. This was a highlight of our trip, so happy we got to visit.

631493073.name: Beautiful Place
631493073.author: a TripAdvisor user
631493073.reviewBody:
You should visit the island at least one time in your life.
The sea is nice and water is clear, but not as clear as I expected.
Prices are high in all the island, restaurants and hotels.
The only way to move is in golf cars and there is not pavement only sand. When it rains there is a lot of puddles.
It's nice to relax, enjoy the pool, the sea, some restaurants and tours.

630175802.name: Holbox or Tulum in second half of October
630175802.author: a TripAdvisor user
630175802.reviewBody:
Two years in a row we have come to Mexico over the kids half term break in October. Now I believe the time of year is important, as the sea behaves differently at different times. 
In Tulum we had an amazing beach with beautiful sand, no seaweed, turtles hatching.... We rented a car and visited cenotes, an entertainment park etc. 
In Holbox the sea was lovely but much less beach other than on the day the ride really went out. The water was still gorgeous but the small strips of beach, whilst whitening the photos, are actually covered with little shells. We did a note trip to one cenote, bits island, saw flamingos. The island itself is not so great. And with a lot of standing water, even more mosquito infested than Tulum. 
Hotels on Holbox have better pools than Tulum, where only a handful of hotels have one, and even then it's more of a dipping pool. 
But from an adults perspective Tulum over Holbox wins because of the restaurants. Some of the food we had in the beach restaurants of Tulum was simply spectacular. Whereas in Holbox, some of the better rated venues were more akin to school lunches. 
Especially if you are going with kids for more than three nights ibwoukd strongly recommend Tulum.  There is more to do when the little ones need a brwaknfrom the beach, the beach is better and you will enjoy the superb Mexican food much more.

629274877.name: Breathtaking island!
629274877.author: a TripAdvisor user
629274877.reviewBody: Beautiful, authentic island with white sand, good food, and the best people. There is a lot of activities to do if you\'re a bit adventurous!

627826702.name: Incredible Gem
627826702.author: a TripAdvisor user
