627826702.reviewBody: Loved the island but it is getting very touristy and expensive. We most enjoyed biking the island. I would recommend that you visit it asap because it is going to be highly impacted by tourism in the next two years....

626611222.name: A little to rough
626611222.author: a TripAdvisor user
626611222.reviewBody:
We love small get away towns but this was just a bit to rough for us. Small town atmosphere with a great night life in the city square at night. But the streets were very muddy and trash and decay were prevalent. It is so amazing as something as easy as a simple tractor could fix every street in town in less then a week but the locals just don’t seem to care about the LARGE pot holes and mud holes. Yes it was the rainy season but per the weather reports it hadn’t rained in town for a good week. We were warned about the mosquitos but didn’t here or see any. The hotels to the east seem to have much better beaches then the ones downtown and to the east. 

When the sun sets head over to the city square and see the town come to life. Great food and welcoming restaurants and bars to enjoy. The locals don’t bug you they way they do in Cancun. 

Would return but would stay east of town.

624469576.name: Brilliant beaches & old style Mexico
624469576.author: a TripAdvisor user
624469576.reviewBody: Booked this excursion through TUI and we wished we had just gone by ourselves for a few days to truly enjoy the island the beaches are gorgeous but we only got 30 minutes to spend relaxing, (the beach at our hotel was covered in seaweed so that\u2019s why we booked it) the best way to move round the island and streets are golf buggies due to the roads not being great lots of puddles everywhere it\u2019s quickly becoming a tourist attraction due to the nice beaches it has lots of quirky cafes to eat in its just a shame that we were eating at a hotel due to the package we booked would much prefer to have a local restaurant cater for us felt weird walking into someone\u2019s hotel to eat it\u2019s a lovely little island with lots of quirky shops and local cuisine to try lots of art work to look at and very photogenic worth a visit but our trip was very quick so couldn\u2019t fully enjoy everything the island has to offer when we visit Mexico again will definitely be visiting holbox again

624332955.name: Paradise!!
624332955.author: a TripAdvisor user
624332955.reviewBody: What an amazing Holbox island! Easy to  explore by bike, golf car, taxi car. Be prepared to get sandy feet and wear beach clothes all the time. Plenty of restaurants and hotels and very safe island. Be prepared to take tons of pictures. Wi-fi hard to get also credit card. Bring cash. To get into Holbox Island from exterior need to take a taxi, private transportation, ADO bus or private flight to Chiquila. In Chiquila need to take a 20 min. ferry to Holbox. Once you are in Holbox need to take a golf cart taxi in to your hotel. And then be free to explore the island and take a lots of pictures in the famous hammock by the beach. Enjoy this beautiful Holbox Island \ud83c\udf34!

624210733.name: Holbox excursion
624210733.author: a TripAdvisor user
624210733.reviewBody: The worst excursion ever ...never go in this excursion with TUI...waste of money ...i couldn\'t take a bath in the sea because was reflux and the Coco beach was  a horrible beach without toilet in a deplorable state

623874450.name: Peaceful
623874450.author: a TripAdvisor user
623874450.reviewBody: My go to peaceful place, great beaches, not crowded.  Is getting busier and busier since first visit.  Should check out before it changes too much.

616153185.name: Vacation
616153185.author: a TripAdvisor user
616153185.reviewBody: The Island is peaceful,beautiful and the avenue is full of good places to eat starting with the famous lobster pizza and various types of restaurants(Viva Zapata was one of my favorites).Also you can find pieces of art such a Murals painted over the Island and nice people \nThere are activities beginning to visit the Bioluminescent beach witch is one of the phenomenal moments in your time life \nWalk the Island,rent a bike or golf car and enjoy the journey

616100942.name: Amazing Time
616100942.author: a TripAdvisor user
616100942.reviewBody: I had an amazing 3 days in Holbox.  First, the place I rented was cheap and beautiful complete with AC and WiFi.  The seafood was the freshest of my life (seafood that had been alive an hour ago) and the beach was never more than 4 blocks away.  The sky is so clear you can stargaze and see Jupiter as well as as swim in water that is clean and pure.  To stay here you need a sense of adventure because there is lots of wildlife, insect bites, bats at night, no clear road signs and WiFi that comes and goes.  And it is 99% cash only!  Only a few places accept plastic.  Please note that the ADO bus that takes you from the Ferry at Chiquila back to the Cancun airport only has 4 departures per day so plan carefully.  And yes, there are lots of European millennials.  Other than that, if you want to get off the grid a bit and enjoy wildlife and superb beaches then this is the adventure for you. :)

615743145.name: Four days with mixed reviews
615743145.author: a TripAdvisor user
615743145.reviewBody: First of all, I liked Isla Holbox on my first visit years ago. A small laid-back village with a great vibe.  This trip the phrase that comes to mind exploding construction with no thought to infrastructure and way too many tourists.  On the surface today, it is a Euro- millennial hangout with a load of hostels and low-cost rentals.  The disparity between the low to medium to high-end establishments is wider than most Mexican stops in my opinion.  I feel the rapid expansion has reduced the charm of the place.  Granted that could be said about many of the great places in Mexico but it hit me particularly hard here.  Something is lost, but then again if it was my first visit... how would I know?

615477353.name: Paradise
615477353.author: a TripAdvisor user
615477353.reviewBody: The perfect place to relax and enjoy beautiful views.\nYou must go to the Bioluminescence and try the \u201cpanuchos\u201d at Abuelo Tom.

613931211.name: WOW, WHAT A BEACH!!!!
613931211.author: a TripAdvisor user
613931211.reviewBody:
Absolutely stunning beaches, good cheap food, quirky little town. 

This is an absolute "must to go see" if you're sick of the seaweed on the Eastern Caribbean coast. 

Warm green / blue water welcomes you after a 20 minute walk from the port through sandy, muddy streets filled with off road vehicles. 

The land that tome forgot was what I was feeling here and will ABSOLUTELY GO BACK.

Tell em' Chicago Joe sent ya....

612246078.name: Just Paradise!
612246078.author: a TripAdvisor user
612246078.reviewBody: We visited Holbox with our two 8-year old daughters. It was pure bliss. The sunset, color of the sea and the great little restaurants.

611954128.name: Stunning beaches at a laid back place.
611954128.author: a TripAdvisor user
611954128.reviewBody: We spent a week here and loved it! Totally relaxed pace with clear water and beautiful beaches. We loved it!

611485834.name: Incredible Island!
611485834.author: a TripAdvisor user
611485834.reviewBody: This island is wonderful! The ocean is free of sargassum and the water is clear. The beach is really nice. We had a wonderful time there and we would really recommend it. If your an animal lover go to the animal refugio were you can take a dog and go for a walk on the beach.

611149687.name: Shhh! Don\u2019t tell anyone!
611149687.author: a TripAdvisor user
611149687.reviewBody: It is amazing! This is the Mexico I have searched for. Dirt streets very laid back. Everything from the food to the beach\u2019s was incredible. I am going back soon.

610671745.name: Beautiful Island!!
610671745.author: a TripAdvisor user
610671745.reviewBody:
If you have heard about and want to visit HOLBOX ISLAND, Cancún, you definitely should.

The ferry trip to get there is around $8 dlls per person and takes around 20 minutes.  Once you arrive you will notice there are no cars nor paved roads in the Island.  An array of golf cart taxis will be there to greet you, ready to take you to your destination.

The beach is gorgeous and not deep, making it safer for children.  There are plenty of beautiful areas where you can relax, enjoy the sunset and even get an outdoor massage.  

One recommendation for people with disabilities... Call the hotel directly and research before you book your room.  Many hotels have many steps and no elevator.  If this is important to you, call them directly.  There are hotels for every budget and be sure to enjoy everything there is to do in the Island.  The food is delicious anywhere you go. 

We stayed here two nights/3 days.... Wish we had had more time to enjoy it's beauty.

Enjoy!!

610011526.name: Beautiful Island
610011526.author: a TripAdvisor user
610011526.reviewBody: We booked a trip to Holbox Island through Exlpora Tours and our guide was Alex he was so amazing, I would definitely recommend him in a heart beat, it was about an hour and 45 ride to the City of Chiquil\u00e1 from our Resort we stayed at the Moon Palace and from there we took a small boat, first stop was Yum Balam to get refreshed, it\u2019s not a Cenote it\u2019s a waterhole, the next stop was Isla Passion which was amazing, Alex said it\u2019s called Passion Island because of all the birds mating... and final stop Holbox Island, there your given the option to rent a golf cart or a bicycle is included with the tour itself we opted for the golf cart because our daughter is 21 Months, the island itself is really small you have plenty of time to take photos before you meet up for lunch, the food was okay, you are then given more time to spend time on the beach or walk around town, this place is very laid back lots of murals throughout the streets, we enjoyed everything about it. I would highly recommend it.

609201226.name: Quiet Getaway
609201226.author: a TripAdvisor user
609201226.reviewBody: If you\'re looking for a lot of nightlife and you enjoy buffalo wings; this is NOT your place.  If you like quiet, pristine beaches, crystal clear water, freshly grilled seafood and don\'t mind sand in your toes; Isla Holbox is perfect.  It\'s not easy to get there; but it\'s worth it.

608978224.name: Amazing Place
608978224.author: a TripAdvisor user
608978224.reviewBody: The beach and the sea are so beautiful, the sunsets are mind blowing. You can walk more than 10mts and the water is still low, the food is great and cheap.

606919165.name: LOVE IT!!!
606919165.author: a TripAdvisor user
606919165.reviewBody: Best place in Mexico. Very safe and old fashioned (in a good way).Love the no car policy on the island.

605126154.name: Great island
605126154.author: a TripAdvisor user
605126154.reviewBody: I had a great time at holbox I we t with my 6 years old daughter she had great time too . relaxing time we enjoy each day at the beach. Great food I\'m just little disappointed with hotel I choose spirit holbox but few steps from spirit we found great beach club with great services and good food and drinks.  I spend 5 days in the island I\'m planning my next trip to holbox I love it .

605026524.name: Absolutely Beautiful
605026524.author: a TripAdvisor user
605026524.reviewBody: This is one of the most beautiful places I have ever visited. The sea is clear blue and warm, the beaches are untouched and the town is buzzing. It is less touristy than other places in Mexico which makes it more special to visit. You can go swimming with whale sharks, watch the beautiful sunsets, see plankton, explore the town, try great street food and much more. So worth a visit!

604402285.name: Perfect except for the mosquitoes
604402285.author: a TripAdvisor user
604402285.reviewBody: Had been told by almost everyone who has been to Holbox that we must go, and I\'m glad we did because it\'s a beautiful, laidback, slow moving, rustic place. However, not a single person mentioned the absolutely ferocious insatiable swarms of mosquitoes that follow you everywhere, even onto the beach. They bite through clothing and generally make going outside a challenge. We were there in June, so perhaps it was worse than usual, but we were later told by locals that Holbox is known locally as "Mosquito island". Swimming with the Whalesharks was amazing and as a bonus, there\'s no mosquitoes in the open ocean! Pro tip: bring plenty of repellent, I went through a large family sized spray bottle in 3 days (and I\'m a smaller than average sized person)

604184699.name: Super experience
604184699.author: a TripAdvisor user
604184699.reviewBody: Whale sharks (for real), beautiful white beaches (access worth it by canoe or boat is best), dolphins, loads of flamingos, fishing, bioluminescence (in summer season not to be missed - we didn\u2019t have his on our list and it is so unique) Great food and great chilled out party atmosphere  (perhaps take lodging away from main centre if you want to get some peaceful sleep).

603468860.name: Island of your dreams \ud83d\ude0d and sooo cheap!
603468860.author: a TripAdvisor user
603468860.reviewBody:
I went to Holbox for my birthday to swim with whale sharks and manta rays. The pace of the island is amazing you instantly unplug and slow down. The walks on the beach and in the shallow crystal clear water with super slow waves are like a dream.

Swimming with whale sharks? What can I say, you can’t touch them but you can’t help feeling you wanna hug them.

I’ll be back for more.

603327620.name: Wonderful island, but can\'t take my eyes away from all the garbage
603327620.author: a TripAdvisor user
603327620.reviewBody: What a pearl - this small Holbox Island. Spent 3 days there in the wonderful and exeptional hotel Punta Caliza.\nBUT: It is dissapointing, how garbage spead out everywhere, can ruin the overall picture. Why does no one take responsability for setting up more garbage cans or even pay people to collect garbage? It is probable, that it is the tourists who create most garbage - then let them pay for it......Let all tourists contribute to a solution of the problem, eg by paying eg. 500 Pesos in garbage/tourist-tax pr. stay, so it can be collected. This might be good for inhabitants, visitors, animals and the overall environment.\nI will be happy to pay such a tax and contribute to a more clean Holbox!

600007749.name: Heavenly island
600007749.author: a TripAdvisor user
600007749.reviewBody: I took the ferry to get to the island (it takes about 40 minutes) once on the island we found there are no cars at all, no paved streets, just sand. You can walk, or take a taxi golf cart or rent one.  We opted for renting a golf cart for 3 hours buy I wish I rented it for 5 hours or more. Having the golf cart gave out the opportunity to travel to a beach with fewer people and we were able to go to Punta Coco, which is one of the best beaches to visit while in the island. the water is so shallow and clean that my kids didn\'t need a vest to run around the water chasing fish. Be aware, it is about 2 hour drive from Cancun and 40 minutes on the ferry, leave early in the morning so you have time to enjoy the island if visiting for one day. I think a 2 day stay on the island would be enough to visit and do all the attractions. Not too many hotels, so make sure you have reservations before arriving or be ready to sleep by the beach. I recommend to bring cash, pesos if possible.

595084024.name: Special little gem!
595084024.author: a TripAdvisor user
595084024.reviewBody: We spent 4 days in Holbox and can\u2019t wait to go back. It\u2019s a tiny island in the Yucatan about 2 hours from Canc\u00fan, then a 30 minute ferry ride from the port town Chiquil\u00e1. Our main reason to visit was to snorkel with Whale Sharks-which was an experience I will truly never forget. \nMode of transportation on Holbox is walking, riding bikes or taking a golf cart taxi...dirt roads and open air restaurants. The biggest downfall is the amount of mosquitoes, so just be prepared for that

591042830.name: No Longer a Secret but Still a Great Place to Unwind
591042830.author: a TripAdvisor user
591042830.reviewBody:
Come if:
you want to do nothing other than umwinding, reading books, walking around, eat food, and... lay on the beach. 

Don’t come if:
Fast WiFi, reliable ATM, luxuries are musts. 

Now I was expecting much less developed rustic island, but it wasn’t- the place has few sushi places, semi- gourmet cafes, mixologist bars and aspiring Michelin restaurants, oh and party hostels. 

That being said, it’s still “chill” island with friendly locals and still affordable options(though considerably more costly than some other parts of Mexico- it’s a remote island where everything needs to be brought in). 

Beach here is big and long enough that even in 110% occupancy it’ll never be as packed as other parts of Quintana Roo. 

And best of all- sand bar to Punta Mosquito- words don’t describe how you’d feel when you stand there. 

I was on a solo retreat for over a week and found the place hard to meet other travelers unless you are young and hostel kids. If your Spanish is solid the locals here are awesome and helpful.

589819377.name: Isla Holbox
589819377.author: a TripAdvisor user
589819377.reviewBody: This place was a 10 with its beach and wildlife. Got to see flamingos and little fish in the water. The water is so clear you can see everything. Had some drinks and fried fish on the beach. Diffently a place to visit while your in the Yucat\u00e1n.

585641991.name: PERFECTLY TRANQUIL
585641991.author: a TripAdvisor user
585641991.reviewBody: This is by far the best choice of a place to visit in mexico. A little bit of a drive to get to (2 hour shuttle plus ferry) but so worth it. It is quaint, peaceful, and not so touristy. Locals are kind, helpful and appreciative. Restaurants and shops are darling, You can bike the whole beach in a few hours if you rent bikes. The water is crystal clear and is always inviting of a swim. We both have never been so relaxed in our lives. Why pay tourist prices for other parts of mexico when you can go to Holbox and live like a King or Queen. It was the best decision we made. We will DEFINITELY be going back. Don\'t forget to try Roots pizza for lobster pizza, Tortilla Hispanola, and Hotel Palapa.

585446724.name: Be aware there are hundreds of crazy mosquitos and flooding in June
585446724.author: a TripAdvisor user
585446724.reviewBody: We heard about how holbox is a paradise and I\'m sad to say we were hugely disappointed, it was probably just a bad time of the year to come. The streets were flooded every afternoon so you can\'t walk anywhere without wading in huge ponds in the street, the water doesnt drain away all day, and with that come the many MANY mosquitos everywhere, they seem much more aggressive (and fast!) than the mosquitos in the mainland and bug spray simply doesn\'t work on them! We just weren\'t enjoying it after 2 days of just being bitten by mossies and wading through flood, didn\'t justify the expensive costs on the island so we cut our stay short. We got to enjoy playa coco for a few hours before the rain came, but it wasnt the most beautiful beach I\'ve been to in Mexico, I guess the appeal is it\'s very shallow and calm (and those hammocks in the sea), the one thing I liked that was different to other Mexican beaches is how there\'s small trees growing along it so there\'s a chance to get shade (although not on soft sand) without having to pay a restaurant extortionate sums for some shade.

585339032.name: Paradise!
585339032.author: a TripAdvisor user
585339032.reviewBody: Such a cute Island. Off the beaten path. I love the hammocks in the water, the sea is calm and shallow, great for kids. I went in June and the mosquitos were HORRIBLE! So if you go bug spray is a MUST!

585115566.name: So-So
585115566.author: a TripAdvisor user
585115566.reviewBody: The beach is beautiful but we stay in canc\u00fan so didn\u2019t worthy the 2 hours and half to get there. but is a beautiful beach to see.

584025700.name: Nice Beach
584025700.author: a TripAdvisor user
584025700.reviewBody: Really like Isla Holbox, very relaxing and fun. The sands are more like mud. \n\nIt was raining on our 2nd day there, though. The streets were flooded. I guess being under development, the culvert system there was not well developed yet. The rain lasted about 2 hours, but streets were wet even until the next day when we departed the island. But the island is clean so you wouldn\'t see black muddy water. People walked around, even ate at the main square while dipping their feet on the water.

583931460.name: A Quaint Colorful Island
583931460.author: a TripAdvisor user
583931460.reviewBody: It was a photographers paradise! All the colorful houses and businesses and the beautiful graffiti. The beautiful turquoise waters made this little island amazing. Not really any cars....just golf carts and bikes. Very quaint and quiet place to soak in some sun rays and just chill!\n

580504835.name: One of the most beautiful places I have visited
580504835.author: a TripAdvisor user
580504835.reviewBody: It is hard to describe so much beauty. It\'s just amazing. You can rent a bicycle, a golf cart and drive through the shore. Admire the sea views, hotels, come across friendly people and most of all it\'s still a safe place. You can walk anytime without any danger. However, don\'t leave your belongings unattended because new people moving to Hotbox is stealing wallets, phones, etc., but you won\'t get robbed at gun point.

579114245.name: Well worth the journey
579114245.author: a TripAdvisor user
579114245.reviewBody: Holbox is unbelievable because it\u2019s real. It\u2019s not an island built for our amusement. Biking around in the morning, off the main strip, you get to see the dozens of locals making their way to work and school kids heading off to class. This gives the island magical reality, especially when you realize it\u2019s 2 hours deep through the jungle from Cancun to even get to the ferry!\n\nWe loved Holbox. The environment, the food, the people. We will most be coming back but Holbox has certainly been discovered. It was mid season (between spring break and whale shark season) and from what we heard during high season the island had twice as many people. That is hard to imagine and certainly the peak of what the island can (or should) withstand.

577224478.name: My happy place
577224478.author: a TripAdvisor user
577224478.reviewBody: We went to Holbox for only 3 nights, and I am so disappointed that we didnt stay the whole week (we went from there to Cozumel).  Holbox is my all time favorite.  I cant wait to plan another (longer) trip there.

671167541.name: Beautiful Walk
671167541.author: a TripAdvisor user
671167541.reviewBody: You can drive or ride to the end of the road and then wade out a small way to the sandbank were you can walk for quite a distance. \nWe took the go-pro and captured loads of stingray, catfish , crabs , among others , great place.

665387387.name: A little bit of effort for a wonderful result
665387387.author: a TripAdvisor user
665387387.reviewBody: To get here it\u2019s best to hire a bike and cycle as far as you can north. After that, it\u2019s a bit of a trek through thickets / along the beach until you can\u2019t go any further. And then you turn left and walk into the sea until you hit the sandbar. Turn right, walk along the sandbar and you\u2019re there (alternatively instead of walking along the beach walk out to the sandbar as soon as you see it). I\u2019m guessing the experience is different depending on the tide. For us, wading through the turquoise waters was a waist deep affair, the sandbar below the knees. A very beautiful \u2018beach\u2019.

664604491.name: Not so nice
664604491.author: a TripAdvisor user
664604491.reviewBody: We been there to see the Bioluminiscence, but due to a not so good weather and a lot of mosquitoes, need to came back to our hotel, May be next time

661209461.name: Rent a bike and go to this paradise beach
661209461.author: a TripAdvisor user
661209461.reviewBody: Just 10 minutes by bike from Holbox "City", you find this amazing beach where you can be for yourself if you choose, or place your self close to the very small little bar, where they mix the best refreshing drinks,  and then go back and look at the view

659389942.name: a must
659389942.author: a TripAdvisor user
659389942.reviewBody: There were so many differing reviews off Punta Mosquito and I don\'t quite understand the concern...we rode our bikes out in the morning and walked through knee deep water to the sand bar and then along the sand bar.  It was so so so very beautiful and it turned out to be one of our favorite experiences.  NO concern about the tide or length of walk.  It was about 3.5 miles round trip through very shallow water.

658300616.name: Accurate being called Punta Mosquito
658300616.author: a TripAdvisor user
658300616.reviewBody: Cute little town. Nice boat excursions to island that are wildlife reserves. Plenty of birds. The town center is the only place lit up at night. Easy to get turned around and lost while walking in the evening. Nice people, good restaurants. Especially great Argentinian restaurant.\nWe were absolutely eaten alive by the bugs. Even indoors. The worst ever anywhere Ive been. They dont care what type of repellent you\'re wearing. We tried several. You\'re fresh, tasty meat. Good news is that the mosquitoes dont carry dengue fever, or malaria on Holbox.

657599448.name: Rent a boat and captain, have them bring you here.
657599448.author: a TripAdvisor user
657599448.reviewBody: We rented a boat with a captain and had him bring us here.  We brought food and drinks with us and had our own snorkle gear. The water is very shallow, warm and clear.  You can walk for ever and not be bothered.

655074428.name: Must visit
655074428.author: a TripAdvisor user
655074428.reviewBody: We rented bikes and rode out then walked out to the sand bar from the end. It is beautiful, peaceful water and a great picnic spot as well! Walking is long and if you take a golf cart you will still have to walk a ways, bikes got us very close comfortably.

654117216.name: Nice walk!
654117216.author: a TripAdvisor user
654117216.reviewBody: It\'s a long walk to Punta Mosquito, around 1h30 from the hotel zone. You can go there only during low tides. You can see nice landscape and birds on the way.

652346283.name: A Must Do!
652346283.author: a TripAdvisor user
652346283.reviewBody: At low tide you can walk for hours along the shallows and beach. The views are stunning, the calmness gives you great piece of mind and the bird life interesting to watch. Our walks to Mosquito Point were fantastic and will be in our memories for life!

651251101.name: One of the most beautiful beaches on earth
651251101.author: a TripAdvisor user
651251101.reviewBody: Stunning, a sandbank that goes on for kilometers. Crystal clear foot deep water and perfectly white sand. A must see when in Holbox. You can walk along the water, or bike/walk along the mangroves to get there. Both options are magnificent. Alternatively rent a kayak and paddle there.

636476443.name: Adventurous Hike to Flamingos at Punta Mosquito
636476443.author: a TripAdvisor user
636476443.reviewBody: From Villas Flamingos, the last hotel on the beachside stretch of properties before the road ends and sandy, sometimes muddy trails begin, it\'s about an hour and a half hike to get to Punta Mosquito. And you\'ll have to wade out into the water, a football field at least, to get to the sandbar, in order to reach your final destination. But the trip is an adventure in and of itself and once you get there, you\'ll spot flamingos so pink you\'ll almost think they\'re fake. It\'s spectacular and a definite must-do for any visitor to Holbox.

448714737.name: have a nice chat, hang with fito and maybe find a necklace for your sister!
448714737.author: a TripAdvisor user
448714737.reviewBody: Small shop.  Probably one of the older shops in town. The owner is pleasant and hillarious!  Fito is a super cool pup. Worth a visit.  Lots of shell jewellery, maybe you\'ll see something you like?

address.streetAddress: Calle Palomino A 100 metros del muelle de Holbox dive center

672341707.name: Part of a trip to holbox
672341707.author: a TripAdvisor user
672341707.reviewBody:
We didn't even expect to be stopping at this small cenote. However it was a nice experience, albeit it's not maintained that well it was so  refreshing on a hot day.

We were here for around 45 minutes, saw some really bright and colourful crabs coming from small holes in the ground as you approach the cenote. 

The pictures show a tower which overlooks the cenote....this hasn't been maintained and has noe fallen to bits. It's a shame as I can imagine this would have been a really good 360 view! 

Entrance was 2 USD.

658365600.name: Small and crowded
658365600.author: a TripAdvisor user
658365600.reviewBody: Although beautiful this place was quickly seen. If there had been less people we would\'ve jumped right in but there were just too many people in it and all around it. We decided to just admire the view from the tower and then drink a couple of cervezas at the "bar". Nice place but once you\'ve seen it you won\'t go back. Nice pit stop on a tree-stop-tour but not for a whole day.

655267603.name: interesting but not that exciting
655267603.author: a TripAdvisor user
655267603.reviewBody: This spring fed lagoon is pretty and fun to swim in, but there is not a lot else to do. We had a 45 minute stop on the island with our boat tour and that was plenty. You can get a drink and some tacos from the locals there, but if you need to use the restroom, be prepared. It is very primitive, and you have to pay a few pesos to use it.

638957794.name: Lovely!
638957794.author: a TripAdvisor user
638957794.reviewBody: The temperature is ideal, the crystal clear water is beautiful. I really liked swimming there. Fun little excursion. And they have empanadas for 15 pesos if you get hungry. :) Entrance is 25 pesos.

638619351.name: Just ok
638619351.author: a TripAdvisor user
638619351.reviewBody: This was my last stop on the "three island" tour. Having been to many other cenotes in the region I thought this one was small and pretty underwhelming. It was fine to jump in and splash around for a few minutes, but I definitely wouldn\'t go out of my way to see this. The place is staffed by a large number of not-completely-friendly people. We bought a couple of empanadas which were fine. There were also pay bathrooms, which seemed a bit much to have to pay in addition to the 35 peso entrance fee.

638459327.name: Regular
638459327.author: a TripAdvisor user
638459327.reviewBody: The place is beautiful, the Cenote is clean but it doesn\u2019t have any facilities, the restrooms are very dirty and the restaurant is so bad attended, the personal is very grumpy. Not a good experience

635309116.name: So awesome
635309116.author: a TripAdvisor user
635309116.reviewBody: Review for VIP Tours Holbox: We met Willy with VIP at Pier Tibur\u00f3n Ballena in Holbox. Willy (our guide) and Christian (boat captain) were both beyond awesome. We had a private tour for our family of 4 - 2 adults, 2 children. Our boat sped ahead of the boat of 20 (25?) to get to Yalahau 1st. Yalahau is cenotes type freshwater lake. Crystal clear and very refreshing. Willy told us about the flora and fauna of the area. Jaguars and alligators are in the area. Because of the speed of their boat we were alone there for 30 minutes - awesome. My daughter said it was the best ever. I agree. We hiked back through the jungle and passed about 35 people coming in - glad we missed them!

631493594.name: Beautiful place
631493594.author: a TripAdvisor user
631493594.reviewBody:
We discover this place on the tour of the three islands.
We stay there only for one hour. You pay 25 pesos at the entrance (aprox 1.25 USD).
You can swim inside the lagoon with very clear water.
After swimming we eat Ceviche there it was really good but not cheap. 250 pesos about 12.5 USD.

630131096.name: A fun little tour!
630131096.author: a TripAdvisor user
630131096.reviewBody: We visited this place on the tree island tour. Which was quite charming. The lagoon is nice, the restauran is ok. I

614696265.name: Good experience! Relax
614696265.author: a TripAdvisor user
614696265.reviewBody: Not the most amazing cenote, but perfect for relaxing and swimming. The water is perfect and the cold water helps recovering from the high temperatures!

600532954.name: Wild in the bad sense
600532954.author: a TripAdvisor user
600532954.reviewBody: I remembered Yalahau like it was yesterday. Blown away on arrival. Sunk in the cristal clear water, everyone loved it. It is extremely wild, once in the water we were face to face with a small aligator. He swamaway when he saw us but we seriously freaked out. No warning at all.

586011508.name: Oasis in the jungle
586011508.author: a TripAdvisor user
586011508.reviewBody: Nice place to get to know 30minutes away from Holbox pier. It is also part of the "classic" three island tour that everybody offers

585336844.name: Refreshing Swim
585336844.author: a TripAdvisor user
585336844.reviewBody: This is a nice cenote to jump in and cool down. The w\u00e1ter is clear and very refreshing. It is just a square cenote so its not that interesting in compared to other cenotes but nice for a quick swim.

585117532.name: Cool clear waters!
585117532.author: a TripAdvisor user
585117532.reviewBody: beautiful clear water pool in the preservation. Only way to get here is by boat with a tour but well worth the time

580502245.name: Take a trip, rent a sailboat not a boat
580502245.author: a TripAdvisor user
580502245.reviewBody: The 7 different colors of the water makes an amazing experience. \nTry to rent a sailboat and not a boat to contribute to the environment. The lagoon isn\'t too big. If people start renting boats the lagoon will start getting dirty of fuel and its beauty won\'t last for a long time.

577223192.name: Beautiful
577223192.author: a TripAdvisor user
577223192.reviewBody: Gorgeous clear cenote with water flowing in from the bottom.  Nice lookout tower to get pictures from above.  Refreshing!

570203068.name: Tourist trap, beware
570203068.author: a TripAdvisor user
570203068.reviewBody:
Very underwhelming cenote, crowded with tourists whose diving and kicking takes the clarity of of the water. 
Poor maintenance from a small "group" of locals that charge $15 MXN to let you in and don't bother to clean animal feces from the spring deck,maintain proper bathrooms (extra 5mxn for filthy cabinet ) or control how people enjoy the cenote (kids diving and adults kicking the sediment).
If you want to visit other cenotes Tulum ,Cancún and Merida have much better options, this tour needs to either be better regulated by officials or simple be closed for preservation.
P.S the small alligator on the entrance is cool untill you realized he dress of scraps and waste of local sailors

566516686.name: Fresh water cenote
566516686.author: a TripAdvisor user
566516686.reviewBody:
This is a nice (little) fresh water Cenote. 
Since it is quiet small you should go on a cloudy day, otherwise it will be really busy.

There are also some lovely raccoons.

560741189.name: Not that interesting
560741189.author: a TripAdvisor user
560741189.reviewBody: Went on a three island tour and this was one of the stops. I\u2019ve been to Mexico before and seen real Cenotes and that\u2019s interesting, this is just a really small fresh water lagoon. Nothing that I\u2019d recommend spending money to see.

560368404.name: Nice cold dip!
560368404.author: a TripAdvisor user
560368404.reviewBody: It was a cool spot to visit and go for a dip. The water is cold and sweet! There are iguanas and raccoons roaming around the area which is fun to watch. They have a little restaurant in the location as well. The cenote is not huge but large enough for a lot of people to go swimming at the same time.

559829606.name: Clear refreshing dip
559829606.author: a TripAdvisor user
559829606.reviewBody: I went to this place on a tour at 9am, which meant our boat had the place to ourselves. Highly recommend this hour, because if it were the usually crowded situation, it would have not been very nice. It is much smaller than the photos show, but it is truly refreshing!

552587085.name: I saw a racoon eat a bag of crisps
552587085.author: a TripAdvisor user
552587085.reviewBody:
This place is teeming with wildlife, the boat journey over was magical with little dolphins swimming next to the boat.
Once moored you take a walk up a cute little path surrounded by crabs and lizards. 
The history of this place is awesome and added to the magic. 

Then we came to the main attraction... A little bandit eating a packet of crisps, honestly the best part of the day! 

But seriously the pool was cold but worth the dip, crystal clear water amazing natural springs!

100% would dip in again.

542635412.name: A great spot to enjoy
542635412.author: a TripAdvisor user
542635412.reviewBody: I visited this lagoon with VIPS tours with Negro & Jaime, the owner. It was a full day tour with many good friends and i loved the fresh waters and the interesting historic spot!

541445662.name: Fun natural wonder
541445662.author: a TripAdvisor user
541445662.reviewBody: This was the last stop of a boat tour we took. There is an admission charge, 15 pesos each (.79)  and is a nice civilized but not touritie site to visit. You can swim the clear water or enjoy the view from the tower in all directions. We thought it was great!

530937770.name: Busy.
530937770.author: a TripAdvisor user
530937770.reviewBody: A bit over crowded on the day of our visit but I can see how great it can be if you go there when all tourists are not there all at the same time with 20 buses.

528830297.name: Meh. Over-crowded, murky water, dirty bathrooms. More of a swimming hole than a cenote.
528830297.author: a TripAdvisor user
528830297.reviewBody:
We came here as part of 3-island tour from Holbox. It was really really crowded with tourists (as in, you're bumping into people all the time in the water or on the decks around the water). 

Granted, the water was nice and cool and refreshing. However, there's a coating of slime all over the plants in the water. Perhaps that's due to the high number of visitors or pollution. I've been to several other beautiful cave cenotes near Tulum that blow this out of the water. 

However, the mangroves leading to the cenote are very pretty and there's a cute friendly wild raccoon that you can hand-feed onsite. And some huge iguanas!

525601152.name: Busy but refreshing
525601152.author: a TripAdvisor user
525601152.reviewBody: This is a nice change from the ocean - a beautiful secluded freshwater natural spring lagoon. There\'s also a high tower where you can see the jungle around.

518354729.name: Relaxing
518354729.author: a TripAdvisor user
518354729.reviewBody: It\'s not hard don\'t have to be in great shape great on kayak but it was definitely a wonderful excursion life is beautiful

512684603.name: Crab tastic fresh water lagoon
512684603.author: a TripAdvisor user
512684603.reviewBody: If you\'re a crab lover you will very much enjoy a huge array of tiny to massive crabs on your walk to the lagoon, they live in massive holes in the ground that to the untrained eye look like they should house tarantulas. Toilets were terrible, try to avoid going if you can, but lagoon was lovely and refreshing. Apart from that there\'s not much there so a 45 minute-1 hour stay is enough. We went here as part of a 3 island trip, and it was a welcome swim during a hot day. A little crowded at times, but a good experience as part of a morning of exploring.

506297700.name: Beautiful
506297700.author: a TripAdvisor user
506297700.reviewBody: Hubby and I loved it!!!!  Cold fresh water lagoon and wonderful wildlife.  The boat ride there was fabulous!!!

502059502.name: Refreshing experience
502059502.author: a TripAdvisor user
502059502.reviewBody:
The lagoon is wonderful and extremely refreshing. Heat in the are is a challenge
So a visit to the lagoon is appreciated. 
There is a small fee to pay once in the lagoon, not included with trip. 
There aren't clean restrooms and the places needs cleaning and maintenance. 
Focus on the lagoon itself and enjoy the view.

501911207.name: Good but...
501911207.author: a TripAdvisor user
501911207.reviewBody: It could be better. Very busy and a bit unorganized  to enjoy. Nice boat trip but negotiating the price can be a headache.

501772360.name: Very pretty!
501772360.author: a TripAdvisor user
501772360.reviewBody: Wonderful place! It\'s a fresh water hole, beatiful and really refreshing. We visited Yalahau lagoon as part of the "Tres Islas" tour. Very recommendable!

495251731.name: meh
495251731.author: a TripAdvisor user
495251731.reviewBody: I have been to a lot nicer cenotes in Mexico. This one is very small, too many tour boats were all crammed into the dock and it was a real zoo.  The cenote itself felt refreshing but there was garbage visible in a few areas around the edges. A few guys manning a small stand charge you 15 pesos to enter. They also sell cold Tecate.\nThere is a really nice view of the surrounding area from the top of the viewing platform.  I was there as part of the Tres Islas tour that practically every boat on Holbox offers but don\'t to go out of your way just for this cenote.

490364576.name: Worth the trip!
490364576.author: a TripAdvisor user
490364576.reviewBody: My husband who speaks Spanish fluently and is of Mexican heritage, negotiated a good deal for a 3 hour boat trip where we went to 3 different islands. It was lovely because the day was overcast and the boat held only 8 passengers. We spent about 45 minutes swimming in the lagoon. It was so refreshing. We wet lucky enough to see a large flock of Pink Flamingos on the last leg of our trip. Great day!

488041141.name: go early and it will be perfect
488041141.author: a TripAdvisor user
488041141.reviewBody: Enough said! If you go early in the morning (before 10am) you will swim alone and then its totally worth it!

486666978.name: Not worth it
486666978.author: a TripAdvisor user
486666978.reviewBody: This place is far too crowded.  They pile people into a not so large cenote.  And the entrance area seemed quite dirty.  Im not sure if there are any facilities either.  Not worth the visit in my opinion.  Unless there is a time of day when its fairly empty.

485359482.name: Refreshing Visit
485359482.author: a TripAdvisor user
485359482.reviewBody: I visited Yalahau Lagoon as part of a larger boat excursion - the 3 Island Tour out of Holbox Island.  The lagoon is very pretty and refreshing.  It seemed popular with families who were picnicking and enjoying a break from the heat.

484498648.name: Nice lagoon!
484498648.author: a TripAdvisor user
484498648.reviewBody: Was really nice the experience as we came on this "classic" tour and 40 minutes is more than enough to jump into the water and refresh yourself.\n\n

481814436.name: Loved it
481814436.author: a TripAdvisor user
481814436.reviewBody: This was a wonderful stop on a tour of three islands.  It was very refreshing and a great experience!  Would absolutely go back!

479570012.name: Was neat!
479570012.author: a TripAdvisor user
479570012.reviewBody: An interesting stop on the 3 island tour, saw a crocodile. There was food available ,we didn\'t eat but it looked fine, mainly sea food I believe.

479200092.name: Refreshing and beautiful
479200092.author: a TripAdvisor user
479200092.reviewBody: I was missing the mass amounts of cenotes while in Holbox and this quenched my thirst!! The water is wonderful and cool.. I have to admit after awhile it became too packed to swim as groups of people piled in. Not many fish to see at all.

477218636.name: Incivil
477218636.author: a TripAdvisor user
477218636.reviewBody: Horrible bathrooms. Worst experience ever. There was faeces in the bathroom. Overcrowded and an average cenote With garbage in it around it

477183388.name: A swim-stop at the bird island / three island tour.
477183388.author: a TripAdvisor user
477183388.reviewBody: Clear waters. A observation tower with 360 view of the surroundings, and the inland /south looks like it could be in africa.

475831839.name: Refreshing
475831839.author: a TripAdvisor user
475831839.reviewBody: Lovely freshwater cenote visited as part of the three island tour. Quite crowded but lovely to see so many locals enjoying the dip. Remember to bring 15 pesos for entry.

470938517.name: good times, cold water, nice excursion
470938517.author: a TripAdvisor user
470938517.reviewBody: We went here on a 3 island tour and it was fun. NOthing to really go above and beyond that. If you are looking for a nice dip in a fresh water lagoon this is it. If you have done that before, you can skip it.

468012280.name: lovely cool FRESH water spring
468012280.author: a TripAdvisor user
468012280.reviewBody: Go early in morning. Can get busy by looking at the number of boats arriving as we left.  Great look-out post.

463830983.name: Absolutely Beautiful!!!!
463830983.author: a TripAdvisor user
463830983.reviewBody: We\'ve been coming to tulum for 10 years now and have bought property and retiring here next year. This was our first time to Holbox, however, and I can\'t wait to come back. We drove from Tulum to chiquila. It took maybe two hours. There is people holding up signs for parking. 50 pesos for day.  We caught ferry from chiquila to holbox. That was 15-20 minutes. You can either walk our get a taxi over to beach. It is absolutely breath taking. There was a few restaurants and bars on the beach. We got a kick out of two dogs running and playing on beach and in the water, without a worry in the world. Now that\'s a dog\'s life. Haha. The ferry runs every half hour, so stay as long as you like. They also have hotels over there to stay in.

462730528.name: Impressive natural reserve
462730528.author: a TripAdvisor user
462730528.reviewBody: The Holbox Island and the lagoon are a... tropical paradise well preserved and very beautiful. February is not the best season to see all the birds and animals, but even so it was an impressive experience - we saw seagulls, pelicans, cormorants, albatross and big egret. They say the best season is May to September, when you can see also flamingos, and you can swim with the whale-shark.

459395446.name: Fun & small fresh water pond to see holes leading inside Earth.
459395446.author: a TripAdvisor user
459395446.reviewBody: Bring your snorkeling gear with you! There are not many fishes but it is nice to snorkel here and see how "cenotes" are born. Maybe not the fanciest cenotes place but a good distance if you are staying at Holbox Island. Take a catamaran trip there! :) Also there is an easy look out to climb before you leave.

458967054.name: Wonderful swim and tower view!
458967054.author: a TripAdvisor user
458967054.reviewBody: Our hotel booked the three island tour for us. We enjoyed seeing more of the area (every other day was spent kiteboarding). The bird island was interesting but our guide kept explaining everything only in Spanish even though 3 of us couldn\'t understand and everyone spoke English. Anyway this island, with the "source of life" spring is not to be missed! Such a lovely swim. There were maybe 6 boats there around 3.30 pm and it was not too crowded. Only change would be our boat captain explaining more in English.

458914621.name: Great for a dip
458914621.author: a TripAdvisor user
458914621.reviewBody: Went here on an organised trip via our hotel. It\'s not a cenote. It\'s a fresh water lagoon. Only 10 pesos to have a swim. Lovely water. Not cold either. Well worth a visit.

450295387.name: Cenote
450295387.author: a TripAdvisor user
450295387.reviewBody: Nice ojo de agua to swim in! Good value for money tours, went on a small boat with a local who told us about the place, really nice!

450267460.name: The Cenote
450267460.author: a TripAdvisor user
450267460.reviewBody: The natives love to share their natural wonders....watch out for the alligators! Nice boat ride if you can ride on a smaller boat....

442976949.name: Amazing!
442976949.author: a TripAdvisor user
442976949.reviewBody: This is an incredible place to come, and take a swim, beautiful landscapes.\nThe saying goes that this was the fountain of youth for the mayan culture

436183463.name: Really cool overlook at the spring
436183463.author: a TripAdvisor user
436183463.reviewBody: Interesting spring near the estuary. Saw some cool tiny fish  snorkeling near the exit of the spring - water cool but nice.\n\nReally beautiful overlook worth the trip to see. Also went to the 2 bird islands. Worth it.

432000017.name: Went here on the 3 island tour
432000017.author: a TripAdvisor user
432000017.reviewBody: We stopped here on the 3 island tour. Overall it was a small little lagoon cenote type water hole, personally I thought it was overrated . Kinda small and crowded , although the water was refreshing but there was a lot of trash around the island. 10 pesos per person to enter but the lady ended up not giving me correct change and took like 50-60 pesos. Saw some cute raccoons running around- they were cute .\n

424346609.name: Pristine!
424346609.author: a TripAdvisor user
424346609.reviewBody: As part of the whales watching tour we visited this place in Mangrove area of the coast and we found unexpectedly a pool of clear, refreshing water which was fed underground from a bubbling spring. Try to have a look deep down the spring - the water is almost 2 meter deep. Bathing here was a treat!

417511259.name: Beautiful spot
417511259.author: a TripAdvisor user
417511259.reviewBody: We stopped at this pool of refreshing water after seeing a couple of other islands on an excursion. Being a small group of 4 in itself was a bonus but once we reached Yalahau most other visitors were leaving or had left. This left us with the whole area to ourselves and it was lovely. Great place to finish our excursion

409762179.name: Go very early. Be the first bird
409762179.author: a TripAdvisor user
409762179.reviewBody: The early bird catches a stupendous place to chill. The water is so refreshing!  Jump into the pool of clean spring water. But be the first to come otherwise it might get crowded. We arrived at 9 am and we were the first ones. It was worth it.

401736024.name: Great swim
401736024.author: a TripAdvisor user
401736024.reviewBody: Refreshing and beautiful spot to escape the heat and humidity. The 75F (or so) water felt so darn good. The other "Islas" were just OK.

398562128.name: 3 Island trip
398562128.author: a TripAdvisor user
398562128.reviewBody: We used Willy\'s Tours for this trip as we had for Whale Shark trip.  Went to the lagoon, very refreshing and cool water, a refreshing change, some small fish to see and a good look out point, we also saw an small alligator in the sea on the boat back.  After this we were taken to Passion Island and saw flamingos, pelicans and other sea birds, again there was an interesting look out point with stunning views of Punta Coco and the beautiful white sand and turquoise sea.  Lastly we went to Bird Island, very interesting as you view the island from a wooden viewing platform and it really is a sanctuary for protection of birds in the area.  The captain and his nephew, Fabio were very helpful and knowledgeable about the area.  The trip took about 3 hours and was really enjoyable, water was provided,

396911621.name: Absolutely best
396911621.author: a TripAdvisor user
396911621.reviewBody: Visiting a magical destination like this reminds you of how spectacular this earth is, we feel so happy we were able to visit this location, it was beautiful and special and memorable.

392267023.name: Nice and refreshing
392267023.author: a TripAdvisor user
392267023.reviewBody: We took this tour today from Holbox.  They don\'t tell you ahead of time that there is a ten peso admission cost and they don\'t have change.  It is cool water, but as far as cenotes in Mexico go we\'ve seen alot nicer.  There are ropes to hang on, or bring a life vest.  I heard there are banos, bit I didn\'t see them.  Saw a gator when we got back in our boat.  There were about ,30 other people there, seemed a bit crowded.

391040673.name: Fresh Water Spring
391040673.author: a TripAdvisor user
391040673.reviewBody: After a 1/2 day of travelling by boat to see birds on protected islands, it was nice to stop and swim in a fresh water spring.

389669402.name: Amazing place
389669402.author: a TripAdvisor user
389669402.reviewBody: Definitely go here it\'s stunning as is the fish we ate here grilled fresh with locals who really take care of you.  Their daughter took ours crabbing she loved it!

385978786.name: Incredible!
385978786.author: a TripAdvisor user
385978786.reviewBody: This place is awesome!!! I wanted to be there all day! The water is so transparent and warm, and there are a lot of fishes there.

383164013.name: Freshwater Gems
383164013.author: a TripAdvisor user
383164013.reviewBody: #0 minute boat from Holbox to get to this piece of refreshing paradise. A good relieve from the heat as the water is fresh chill...\nIt deserve a visit

381232874.name: Refreshing swim
381232874.author: a TripAdvisor user
381232874.reviewBody: We visited the lagoon for 40 mins as part of a boat trip.  Worth the visit to have a swim.  We also saw a small crocodile next to the jetty.

379220608.name: \ud83d\ude0e cool!  As long as the crocidile isnt there
379220608.author: a TripAdvisor user
379220608.reviewBody: So this lagoon is the only place i could cool down the whole 10 days in mexico.   It is a very nice spot .... Have small change cause our boat driver told us when we got there that we needed to pay 10 pesos each to gain admittance... \n\ud83d\ude26\ud83d\ude26 that was dishonest of the tour operator and made my life difficult cause i only had big bills sooooo booo on them ...    Besides that the water was great. \ud83d\udc4d   we saw a small \ud83d\udc0a at the entrace near the dock.   Didnt stop us from swimming... Heard the day after tour saw the mama rummaging around on their walk to the spring.   She is over 2 meters so nobody when swimming that day.    Honestly no one has ever heard of crocs in the lagoon mind you.    I found the whole trip worth it paradise island was very beautiful as well.

379073463.name: Cool place to see
379073463.author: a TripAdvisor user
379073463.reviewBody: We stopped there while doing the 3 islands tour. We had the chance to be almost by ourself for 10-15 minutes before it got super crowded. It\'s still a very nice place to see, very refreshing

371650440.name: Cool down
371650440.author: a TripAdvisor user
371650440.reviewBody: Part of the classic tour. Refreshing on a hot day. Was crowded the day we were there. Toilets are primitive, but usable if you gotta go.  If you bring a snorkel try to find the source of the spring, you can see it from above. No fish that I could see.

368864429.name: An interesting place to visit, although a little scruffy
368864429.author: a TripAdvisor user
368864429.reviewBody: Great place to swim and also to climb a wooden tower to see the views. A little scruffy, where there had been a cafe that seemed to no longer be functioning. Crocodiles havve been seen in the vicinity - we saw a small one swimming in the sea.

363434394.name: REFRESHING!
363434394.author: a TripAdvisor user
363434394.reviewBody: fun 3 hour boat excursion during high heat/humidity was very very nice! the is fresh water swimming hole is a must see\n

362826220.name: Beautiful!
362826220.author: a TripAdvisor user
362826220.reviewBody: We went with a tour but had read to find a tour that stayed an hour instead of 30 minutes and were really glad we did. Amazingly clear water in a beautiful setting!

361051230.name: Lovely fresh-water spring worth the excursion
361051230.author: a TripAdvisor user
361051230.reviewBody: We visited the lagoon as part of a 3 hour boat trip from Holbox and it was worth it!  We enjoyed swimming in its crystal clear water- very refreshing from the hot and humid air. Smaller than many cenotes and safety rope now crosses it. You can feel the source of water bubbling up in the center of the Lagoon.

351663885.name: Natural Spring water with a great view of the Island!
351663885.author: a TripAdvisor user
351663885.reviewBody: Took a tour to the Yalahau Lagoon from Holbox Island. We were only there for 30 minutes but was able to swim in the lagoon and and enjoy the beautiful landscape view of the island.

350967998.name: Beautiful spot!
350967998.author: a TripAdvisor user
350967998.reviewBody: We went with a tour and I was so upset they gave such a little time because this place is beautiful!! You see the water coming out from the ground, the water is fresh, clear and with lots of fish. There is a little tower to see the grounds around it. What a bump you have to get there with a tour, this place deserves more than the 40 minutes they gave us.

348205480.name: fresh water after being at sea!
348205480.author: a TripAdvisor user
348205480.reviewBody: Nice refreshing swim after being on a long boattrip in choppy waters! Afterwards you can walk to the top on the stairs beside the cenote and have a magnificent view

346513153.name: small clear water
346513153.author: a TripAdvisor user
346513153.reviewBody: Nice lagoon with clear water in which you can take a swim. Also a very good view over the bush and occasionally birds

343554952.name: Eternal spring
343554952.author: a TripAdvisor user
343554952.reviewBody: Not really the biggest or the best Cenote I have been too but certainly the 10 pesos is well worth it to jump into the water where the fresh water comes out of the ground to form this pool, not too many places in the world you can do that

342174735.name: Worth seeing, but not as good as other Cenotes.
342174735.author: a TripAdvisor user
342174735.reviewBody: Granted the weather was pretty horrible, which no doubt colored our experience, but this is best described as a spring- or lagoon I guess. But many tour operators call it a cenote and if that is what you are expecting, you will be disappointed.

338293418.name: not impressed
338293418.author: a TripAdvisor user
338293418.reviewBody: I guess i am spoilt, Belize has much more to offer in terms of great swimming holes and blue holes. Not much to do at this site. Ok for a 30 min tour tops!

331067759.name: Beautiful day
331067759.author: a TripAdvisor user
331067759.reviewBody: Don\'t miss this. The lagoon is full of pelicans and pink flamingos and the ceviche you eat from the fish you catch is to die for. Fantastic trip!

328414018.name: Fun place
328414018.author: a TripAdvisor user
328414018.reviewBody: Nice little tower and swimming hole. A little cool but, highly tolerable in the hot weather. \nHighly recommended to bring goggles. It costs $10 pesos ($.75 USD) to enter presumably to keep the area clean. Well worth the boat trip to get there.

327792974.name: Super cool.
327792974.author: a TripAdvisor user
327792974.reviewBody: Stunning views from the lookout tower. The watering hole is fresh water sprung from underground rivers that is set in the middle of the rainforest. A quick little walk and you\'re there. Cold water, but not freezing. Usually crystal clear but we had come after some big rain so it was a bit murkier. A fun day.

318828197.name: Very nice!
318828197.author: a TripAdvisor user
318828197.reviewBody: Water is cool and clean, recomanded to go on the bird trip on the way there. bring a camera and a bathing suit!

317047007.name: This should be unmissable visit on your trip to Holbox
317047007.author: a TripAdvisor user
317047007.reviewBody: This is an impressive site. The water is very cold but once you dive into this lagoon you feel comfortable.

316119587.name: Small lagoon.
316119587.author: a TripAdvisor user
316119587.reviewBody: Small lagoon and colder than expected so it was very refreshing in a hot summer day. A short stop here should be nice and plus they only charge a small fee.

310321023.name: pretty little lagoon...so refreshing!
310321023.author: a TripAdvisor user
310321023.reviewBody: We were here as part of a Three Island Tour in Holbox.  While not a cenote it was a welcome and welcoming little pool with clear, clean, cool water.   Rustic, clean, wooden decks, small admission fee --I think under 1.00 US currency just to keep the facility picked up and in good order. .  Make it a stop when you are in the area...there is also a nice look out tower where you can look out over the surrounding \'selva\'.

306623756.name: Crowded and small
306623756.author: a TripAdvisor user
306623756.reviewBody: Although the place could be a paradise, there are so many people visiting that it becomes hard to enjoy it. It\'s a very small cenote with an underground water sprout. There is a wooden tower from where you can see Chiquila and its surroundings. Out side the cenote, there is a place, sort of a restaurant, where you can get ceviche and drinks, among a few other stuff. We just stayed for about 30 minutes, we couldn\'t handle the crowd. Although beautiful and i recommend to visit at least once, I am not sure I would go back.

304534962.name: Good
304534962.author: a TripAdvisor user
304534962.reviewBody: Pretty cenote on a small island, but was quite busy and small. Not our favorite cenote but was still nice.

301782233.name: Crowded and noisy
301782233.author: a TripAdvisor user
301782233.reviewBody:
Visited this as part of a "classic tour"
Tour cost 300MEX each from Holbox - plus a little extra to enter here.
The swim area itself is pretty small - 20m by 7m maybe.
The lookout tower is nice enough - although a little rickety - and not really that much to see.
When we arrived (sunday early afternoon) there were lots of people there - lots of families plus a couple of groups of teenagers. It was loud, lots of drinking and smoking.... not ideal.
By the time we left it was a bit nicer - a bit quieter
The water itself was OK - not big but seemed fresh enough. A few small fish in there. And a few crabs around the edge.
It was "OK"...

300957516.name: Refreshing in Holbox heat
300957516.author: a TripAdvisor user
300957516.reviewBody: small lagoon with chilly water which felt great in the summer heat.  ordered lunch open arrival which was ready after the swim.  Not large like most cenotes in the Yucatan and no shade but a nice change to the salty ocean water surrounding holbox.

300335531.name: Cool!
300335531.author: a TripAdvisor user
300335531.reviewBody: A very very nice, relaxing, comfortable cool and fresh water lagoon while beating the heat and humidity.

293513330.name: Small and crowed
293513330.author: a TripAdvisor user
293513330.reviewBody: It is very crowed and small. The water is not clear like other Cenotes in the Yucatan area I had been too.

293115549.name: Crowded and littered
293115549.author: a TripAdvisor user
293115549.reviewBody: This was described to us as a place to possibly snorkel, but there were too many people in the cenote, churning up sediment - no room to swim and no visibility. Also, inconsiderate folks had left trash along the shoreline. We could see that it was once a beautiful spot, and could be again with more active management.

292208893.name: yalahau lagoon
292208893.author: a TripAdvisor user
292208893.reviewBody: We took a boat trip to the lagoon and were very pleasantly surprised to find this refreshing cenote. It was great to jump in and cool off.  Be sure to have 10 pesos for the entrance fee.

291555931.name: Fresh water cenote
291555931.author: a TripAdvisor user
291555931.reviewBody:
a refreshing stop on a 2 island bird watching boat excursion.

Tower to climb to view jungle of North Mexico.

Tour guides on Isla Holbox are awesome.
Bring some champagne along on the boat for a toast.!!!!

288577027.name: Beautiful place
288577027.author: a TripAdvisor user
288577027.reviewBody: Our visit to the Laggon was as part of a three island afternoon tour.  The tour stops at a tiny island where birds nest, great place for watching birds and other wild life. After the birds\' island we went across the "lagoon" to a beautiful place where a spring is born.  After swimming for a bit we went on to a beautiful beach and on the boat between islands we got to see dolphins and flamingoes.  It is an amazing tour one must take when visiting Holbox

280045521.name: Exciting
280045521.author: a TripAdvisor user
280045521.reviewBody: This little cenote was in the middle of a Savanna like landscape.  The water was very clear, cold and exciting to jump into.  The cenote was surrounded by wooden decking and a multi level area for viewing this beautiful area.

279902480.name: Bring your snorkel and mask!
279902480.author: a TripAdvisor user
279902480.reviewBody: We used Willy\'s Tours to come over to the cenote. A short walk through mangroves brings you to the cenote where you can see the water bubbling up from underground. The water is cystal clear and cool making for a lovely swim. We brought mask and snorkel and were glad we did as there are beautiful fish in the cenote so it was fun watching them and taking photos. There is an observation tower that gives a good view of the surrounding isolated countryside and for taking photos of the cenote. There is a 10 peso admission fee.

279345280.name: Peaceful
279345280.author: a TripAdvisor user
279345280.reviewBody: Clean, fresh and full of color.  \nIt\'s a nice "cenote", refreshing if you are in the middle of a tour.  \nGet it to the blue water.  You don\'t regret.

277417725.name: It\'s not as big as I thought it will be.
277417725.author: a TripAdvisor user
277417725.reviewBody: I recommend more to go to Akumal to the #Yal-ku Lagoon. It\'s quite impressive...  Or in tulum the cenote \'cristal Y Escondido \' give them a try. HOLBOX it\'s not my favorite in the area after 3 days without exciting things to do. \n\nAnd the bathroom \ud83d\udebd is horrible..... Just horrible

274567764.name: Very refreshing
274567764.author: a TripAdvisor user
274567764.reviewBody: Nice spot in the middle of nowhere.  Water is cold, but you wont regret to get a quick bath there.  Be careful  the path can be slipery

272746231.name: The best kept secret!!!
272746231.author: a TripAdvisor user
272746231.reviewBody: A wonderful place I will never forget about. I took almost a thousand pictures. It\'s not just landscape. Don\'t miss it!!!

266008015.name: Small and too many tourist
266008015.author: a TripAdvisor user
266008015.reviewBody: You will be disappointed if you have seen some of the other big lagoons on the peninsula. The water is stirred by all the visitors and therefore you cannot see anything under water.

261659979.name: Private beautiful cenote
261659979.author: a TripAdvisor user
261659979.reviewBody: this was very private and not commercialized, stunning connection to nature. We fished before arriving here, awesome trip, beautiful lookouts as well!!!

259144557.name: noyhing much to see this time of year
259144557.author: a TripAdvisor user
259144557.reviewBody: An experience among others. Nice nature and clean water... as I wanted to see Kingfishers etc. It was the wrong time.

250663358.name: Clear, cold cenote swim in the middle of the jungle
250663358.author: a TripAdvisor user
250663358.reviewBody: It was a first. After a short boat trip across the lagoon and a brief walk in the mangroves. the pristine water hole was serenely beautiful.

248352341.name: Great Marine and Ecological Tour
248352341.author: a TripAdvisor user
248352341.reviewBody: Recommendable are the boat tour of Yalahau Lagoon in the heart of nature itself, highlighted by a visit to the birthplace of cool, clear drinkable water supposed to have restorative properties, also considered "fountain of youth\u201d. Another marvel you may visit, is \u201cIsla Pajaros\u201d with over 160 bird species having paths and two lookouts to see flamingos, herons, ducks ... in their natural environment. Later,  a stopover on Passion Island, an uninhabited place with pristine virgin type beaches.

247001554.name: Not much to it.
247001554.author: a TripAdvisor user
247001554.reviewBody: It\'s a small fresh water lagoon in the middle of the jungle, it\'s about a 100 meter walk from the dock to get to the lagoon, and has a 10 peso entrance fee per person.\nVery touristy, when we went the lagoon was packed with tourists. Some other posts said they were able to snorkel, either they were there alone, or we missed something.\nThere\'s also a tower you can climb to the top and get a nice view and photo ops for the surrounding jungle.

246918344.name: peaceful beautiful place
246918344.author: a TripAdvisor user
246918344.reviewBody: Wonderful way to spend a day.  Expensive if you are not planning on spending at least 1/2 the day.  We rented a palapa that had a hammock and saw all kinds of wildlife as well as unlimited snorkeling. We went off season so was not crowded at all. Would have been better if there were two hammocks in the palapa or beach type chairs to recline in.

244967549.name: Great spot
244967549.author: a TripAdvisor user
244967549.reviewBody: Beautiful set of springs that create a small swimming area in the jungle.  Crystal clear water,  boiling springs, tropical fish.  Snorkel if you can.

241161823.name: Nice stop for the three islands tour
241161823.author: a TripAdvisor user
241161823.reviewBody: We stopped here on the three island tour which is commonly given from Holbox tour guides. Apparently some Mayan king was here and he mentioned something about the fountain of youth.. I don\'t know if he was just rambling but the place was genuinely nice! Lots of wildlife, great tower overseeing a vast amount of land, and the water is delicious to dip in after a hot day!

241039963.name: I LOVE IT
241039963.author: a TripAdvisor user
241039963.reviewBody: this place is amazing!!!! the water is very clear, the water is cold but once you jump there is pretty good, the size of the lagoon is medium, if you are going in low season you will have fun, and also at the entrance, the cookers can prepare a Ceviche fresh and good price and when you  finsh to swim your lunch will be ready!!!\n\nplace that you should visit when you visit holbox

240842954.name: Great outdoor Cenote
240842954.author: a TripAdvisor user
240842954.reviewBody: Very nice tour from Hamaca\'s by the Faro Viejo (old lighthouse).  The lagoon has a elevated observation post, very good view of the completely undeveloped yucatan, very nice.  Lagoon is crystal clear, no trash.  Mechanically, they need to do a little work on the ladders and pathways getting back to the lagoon itself.  Would definitley go back.

229797349.name: Very pleasant place for snorkeling
229797349.author: a TripAdvisor user
229797349.reviewBody: This is a great place for snorkeling, especially for kids, but it can be pretty crowded, thus the best is to get there as early as possible. We initially made the mistake to snorkel on the right side of the lagoon, it was Ok, but we later realized that it was even nicer on the left side. The depth never exceeds 3 meters approximately. The water was close to 30 degree C and very clear in some places. There are toilets, restrooms, shower as well. Enjoy!

218432779.name: For a fresh swim
218432779.author: a TripAdvisor user
218432779.reviewBody: Lets start saying that this is located in the middle of the jungle surrounded by mangroves. You could say that, it is a little roustic, but I guess that is why you go. Its a little cenote with cold sweet water that makes a very refreshing couple of hours dive and swim. Thats it. There is not much to it other than this. It has a wooden tower so you can climb and see the surrounding jungle, and since is the jungle, it could ( because there is the possibility) happen to see alligators or snakes. So beware. Entrance is ten pesos, and I guess, depending on the weather take your repellant because it could have a decent amount of mosquitos and tabanos. And they bit hard. We went at the end on July. No mosquitos, no tabanos, amazing fresh water.\nRecommendation: dont eat there, and if you take food, please take the garbage with you.

206134647.name: Boat tour
206134647.author: a TripAdvisor user
206134647.reviewBody: Enjoyed the three hour boat tour that took in this lagoon. Tiny fish and crabs in abundance. The beer was the perfect end to a perfect day.

204974543.name: That water is COLD!
204974543.author: a TripAdvisor user
204974543.reviewBody: Stopped at Yalahau while our fishing guide prepared ceveche for us on the boat. We enjoyed our brief stay!

200414130.name: Beautiful and Worth the Trip
200414130.author: a TripAdvisor user
200414130.reviewBody: Lots of birds, fish, horseshoes crabs, stone crabs, snails, tiny fish... and the ceviche your guide will make when you get there is the best you\'ll ever have.

199058774.name: Fun little daytrip
199058774.author: a TripAdvisor user
199058774.reviewBody: We enjoyed a three hour boat tour that included this lagoon.  Neat little place where we swam and had a beer.

197344367.name: brilliant lagoon!!!
197344367.author: a TripAdvisor user
197344367.reviewBody: amazing people. nice hotels and exquist food!!\nno cars in the island. just golf cars and bikes....m\nfor sure i will remember this trip  forever!!!!

194433035.name: Alone at the Lagoon...
194433035.author: a TripAdvisor user
194433035.reviewBody: We were brought here by our guide after fishing and came around 11am to avoid the rush of others coming to see this amazing little spot. The walk in to see the lagoon is a little treacherous if you are not agile. You walk on boards laid in the sand that are not uniform but it is typical for this area and adds to the adventure! The water is crystal clear and there are fish that come swim around you when you enter the water. Some money should be invested to keep this area up and accessible without altering the beauty of this cenote.

193802165.name: Nice place for a swim
193802165.author: a TripAdvisor user
193802165.reviewBody: The water here is so clear and refreshing.  You need a boat to get to it.  You can see where the springs come up from beneath.  Climb up to the top and you get a beautiful view of Holbox.  There are small fish in the Lagoon too.  Well worth the trip...

192552372.name: Pirates
192552372.author: a TripAdvisor user
192552372.reviewBody: Went on boat to three locations, including the Ojo de Agua an old pirate cove. Loved nature, sights, birds, and the really friendly boat captain.

187512341.name: A beautiful fresh water lagoon
187512341.author: a TripAdvisor user
187512341.reviewBody: The Yalahau Lagoon is a great couple of hours when you\'re visiting Isla Holbox. The lagoon is similar to the Cenotes found in the Yucatan, however this is in the open surrounded by mangroves, and not in a cave. The lagoon is about 2 meters deep, and about 30 meters wide. The fresh water is cold, but pleasant when you are in the salt water environment of Holbox. We were fortunate, there were no other people there, and there were no Mosquitos.\n\nThere is a wooden tower, about 10 meters high, from which you can view the surrounding area to a distance of about 10 miles. Flat as a pancake. The fee is 10 pesos, and well worth it. You will need a boat ride from Isla Holbox. Enjoy!

183099766.name: Blue lagoon
183099766.author: a TripAdvisor user
183099766.reviewBody: Visited this lagoon and enjoyed the cool blue water for a swim. Stunning spot, and is a perfect place for a couple of hours to soak up the Island tempo. Small charge for a worthwhile visit.

179376493.name: Croc gave us the slip
179376493.author: a TripAdvisor user
179376493.reviewBody: We went to this small but very interesting natural spring. The water was freezing and we did get bitten alive by mosies, put extra repellent on. \nHad hoped to catch a glimpse of the famed Crocodile but no luck.

172225215.name: Nothing special
172225215.author: a TripAdvisor user
172225215.reviewBody: small spring in the trees, VERY cold... we did not get in but it was also storming. Take your bug spray or the mosquitos  will eat you alive.

171939246.name: Seen on tour of 3 islands
171939246.author: a TripAdvisor user
171939246.reviewBody: Just beautiful!  Very unique experience.  A good idea to apply mosquito repellent before going.  Saw a very big croc. They do exist there.  Also understand there are bears near the river area on the island.

169909589.name: Very refreshing!
169909589.author: a TripAdvisor user
169909589.reviewBody: A very nice excursion on a very hot day! Watch ot for the 4 meter long crocodile hiding in the mangrove!

164000256.name: Refreshing! kind of small
164000256.author: a TripAdvisor user
164000256.reviewBody: It is a nice place and fun, but just a small lagoon with a tower.   They have a restaurant on property where you can get food and drinks.  Not somewhere that I would spend a whole lot of time, but is a fun stop on a tour.

160013549.name: Yalahau Lagoon isn\'t a Cenote
160013549.author: a TripAdvisor user
160013549.reviewBody: It\'s a Wonderful place to visit, but it isn\'t a Cenote though, it\'s a Natural Spring. A great place to swim the water is crystal clear. Bring your go Pro.

158718016.name: Neat place to visit
158718016.author: a TripAdvisor user
158718016.reviewBody: This was the last stop on a short excursion. Be prepared to pay 10 pesos per person (and worth it). There was a nice mix of locals and tourist. The wonderful thing about Holbox is the wonderful hospitality. The  Cenote was refreshing and we had fun going for a swim. Some of the members of our group brought mask and snorkels but reported not being able to really to see anything in the water. There is also a viewing platform which provides a very impressive view of the surrounding area.

158150322.name: Good trip
158150322.author: a TripAdvisor user
158150322.reviewBody: They don\'t tell you that you need money to enter the lagoon after you\'ve booked your trip (well our chap didn\'t) so remember to take some money with you!

155883705.name: great cenote in a very abandoned place
155883705.author: a TripAdvisor user
155883705.reviewBody: The cenote is excellent, but the whole place seems to be abandoned and the bathrooms are a stone with a hole and the excrements go directly down in the sand. Smelly and really dirty. It is obscene that a public governemental place for tourism is so dirty. Ecological is one thing, non igienic is another matter. Just go there if you are strong enough to avoid going to pee.

155605023.name: Maybe in thirty years
155605023.author: a TripAdvisor user
155605023.reviewBody: The lagoon is as expected, blue water and skies. We hoped to chat with some interesting people but the visitors would have suited our parents better. Some were fishing, some bird-watching. Not for us really.

668744824.name: the best place to help the animals
668744824.author: a TripAdvisor user
668744824.reviewBody: please if you visit holbox stop by the refugio and help as much as you can, any donations or just walk the dogs, they are there to help all the animals in distress and they do a lot with very little

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

665526251.name: Great people
