665526251.author: a TripAdvisor user
665526251.reviewBody: Thanks for letting us come and visit your furry friends. We stayed 5 nights in Holbox and this was our favorite place to visit. Keep up the good work. Next time we come, I\u2019ll taking a dog home.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

661217703.name: If you love animals go!!
661217703.author: a TripAdvisor user
661217703.reviewBody: This informal, friendly and welcoming refuge for dogs, cats and raccoon is a special place. The staff work tirelessly helping the most needy animals and the pups are loved and happy. Go take a walk, cuddle, and donate to help them continue their work!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

659389569.name: A must
659389569.author: a TripAdvisor user
659389569.reviewBody: We came here every day and it enhanced our trip so much!!!  What amazing folks to do the work they do.  Inspirational!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

657453528.name: HOLBOX MUST FOR ANIMAL LOVERS
657453528.author: a TripAdvisor user
657453528.reviewBody: we visited the refugio daily to give the animals lots of tlc and take dogs for walks and to the beach for the day! AMAZING PLACE!!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

656883941.name: must visit
656883941.author: a TripAdvisor user
656883941.reviewBody: you have to visit this place if you go to holbox, they are doing something great for the animals. they let you walk a dog all day if you want to!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

655659145.name: PLEASE VISIT AND HELP.
655659145.author: a TripAdvisor user
655659145.reviewBody: Wonderful wonderful place to see so many different animals living together with NO PROBLEM. tv\'s should stop here and make a documentary about this wonderful place. HELP THEM when you visit like we did and do not just look and leave. we all have to help.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

654965651.name: Refugio Animal Holbox
654965651.author: a TripAdvisor user
654965651.reviewBody: On an Island saturated with beauty, my trip to Holbox was filled with tranquil, turquoise sea and white sands, but some of our best memories have to be the walks we took with the little dogs from @refugio_animal_holbox \nIf you have the time and want to help out please pay them a visit. The fantastic team there work so hard to provide amazing general and medical care. All animals that come into their care are so happy, free and loved.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

641515094.name: Wonderful sanctuary.
641515094.author: a TripAdvisor user
641515094.reviewBody: It is wonderful sanctuary and although it is a bit heartbreaking to see some of the injured animals, we felt good to visit and make a donation.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

635112154.name: Wonderful place
635112154.author: a TripAdvisor user
635112154.reviewBody: ...with wonderful people. Dont be shy to stop to pet, walk or let a small amount. Such a nice place :)

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

632035993.name: Must visit
632035993.author: a TripAdvisor user
632035993.reviewBody: We visited the refuge and it is heartbreaking how the owner makes every effort to loo after every animal here. Please visit it and donate as we did.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

631763719.name: They are doing a good work
631763719.author: a TripAdvisor user
631763719.reviewBody: The animals are sweet and friendly and clearly love to have visitors to pet them \u2764\ufe0f This is the only animal shelter in the region, a lot of respect for the good work the place is doing. Please visit and donate even a bit during your stay in Holbox! \ud83d\udc36\ud83d\udc31

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

625901055.name: Emotional
625901055.author: a TripAdvisor user
625901055.reviewBody: Every time we visit Holbox we bring things for animals, meds, toys, food, whatever we can get.  It is both sad and heartwarming to see the animals, some injured.  If you plan a trip to Holbox, take them supplies, anything, or stop buy and take an animal out, and leave a donation.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

617770419.name: Heartwarming Volunteer "Must Do"
617770419.author: a TripAdvisor user
617770419.reviewBody: When you visit this sanctuary for animals, you almost immediately see how much love has gone into it.  You\u2019ll meet dogs, cats, kittens, various birds, raccoons, and even a pelican who likes to give little love pecks on your ankles or hands.  Dogs who are paralyzed on their back ends and get around either by pulling with their front legs or with the help of one of the staff are heart wrenching but at the same time you see how well cared for they are and that their quality of life at the shelter is good.  The three-legged dog is a total love bug as are a couple of the paralyzed dogs. The dogs wander around, in and out of the house, take naps on comfy beds in the fresh air and vie for the attention of volunteers and staff.  The cats have their own large enclosure with plenty of spots to hang out and sleep or to run around and play.  Ditto for the raccoons.  We visited three afternoons and they were highlights of our trip.  It\u2019s an easy walk from the main square.  Bring treats from home; the dogs and cats love getting them.  See the website for items that Refugio needs, if you have room in your luggage. This is a wonderful rescue/sanctuary, please visit and share some love.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

601017226.name: For animal lovers
601017226.author: a TripAdvisor user
601017226.reviewBody: We went to the Refugio Holbox a couple of times and we always had a warm welcome. The dogs were always the first ones to welcome us, followed by the amazing staff who clearly love animals. If you like animals make sure you visit this place and help them out!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

592778437.name: Make time to visit!
592778437.author: a TripAdvisor user
592778437.reviewBody: We like going here to pet the animals.  We always make a monetary donation and bring a a dozen leashed and collars from the dollar  store at home.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

591008702.name: For The Love Of Animals
591008702.author: a TripAdvisor user
591008702.reviewBody: As others have written, please visit, donate, and take a dog or two for a walk.\nThey run on donations only and love the animals so much. I can\'t remember our dogs name, but she could not walk very well- could not walk at the shelter at all, so we took her in the wagon for a walk down the beach. She stood up and we put her on the beach where she held her head up high and walked down the beach for a short distance. \nPlease visit and say Hi to a wonderful animal and give a donation if you can.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

588180607.name: Must do if you love animals
588180607.author: a TripAdvisor user
588180607.reviewBody: This animal sanctuary is close to the center of town and a great opportunity to make a difference. Morelia and her volunteers care for injured, sick or abandoned animals and ready them for adoption. There are 40+ dogs (5 paralyzed), kittens, baby and adult raccoons, birds and a newly rescued baby pelican- all living in harmony. They really appreciate visitors- you can walk a dog on the beach or just say hello. Please donate supplies or a little money to support these deserving animals.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

587633030.name: Amazing idea
587633030.author: a TripAdvisor user
587633030.reviewBody: What wonderful people are these. They look after all the injured and homeless animals. What a mix, so heartwarming as they all seem to get on together. You can walk the dogs on the beach, or just donate to their great cause. Wonderful place.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

585589167.name: Visit and donate!
585589167.author: a TripAdvisor user
585589167.reviewBody: Loved our 5 minutes visit and loved the owner and had never seen so many animals living together. Please donate.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

579127579.name: If you LOVE animals, you will love it
579127579.author: a TripAdvisor user
579127579.reviewBody: The owner is awesome, she is so caring and loves her animals. You can genuinely tell that the animals are happy there. You are able to take a dog out for a walk to the beach, and THEY LOVE IT. If you can, PLEASE DONATE. Some animals, due to their conditions cant eat any type of cheap dog food, they need medication, manteniance, etc. \nPlease check out the place if you love animals.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

579113992.name: Amazing
579113992.author: a TripAdvisor user
579113992.reviewBody:
I always try to find a pet rescue wherever we go since my wife loves animals so much. The Refugio did not disappoint (and compared to ones in the Hawaii they sure are lax, no forms to fill out here!). 

Tons of incredible animals here including dogs, cats and the famous raccoon. We took out Oden for an hour who started off very rambunctious but my wife put him under her spell with the quickness. 

We had a little trouble finding it since the maps show it on the beach side of the street. It's not on Av Pedro Joaquin Coldwell like you may think. It's on the side street (I think Calle Tintorera?). 

Very much worth finding, we had a blast.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

579077827.name: They Need Help!!!!!!!!!
579077827.author: a TripAdvisor user
579077827.reviewBody: OMG. If you love animals and care about their welfare, please go and support the lovely Morelia Montes and her staff. They help so many animals in Holbox who are abandoned, crippled and in need of medical attention. We gave a large donation. I hear she has been threatened by the Coca-Cola people who want to take away her rented land. This Refuge is so needed in Holbox. Visit it and donate if you can.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

575559628.name: Please visit and help!
575559628.author: a TripAdvisor user
575559628.reviewBody: Refugio Holbox is a great place taking care of homeless animals. Please visit them and help by donating money or taking the dogs out for a walk!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

571543181.name: If you love animals, go there ! Amazing place.
571543181.author: a TripAdvisor user
571543181.reviewBody: We visited this sanctuary because our hotel recommended it. The place is hold by amazing people, dedicated to animals. Some are handicaped or injured but are very happy there. I recommend you to take some dogs for a walk, the beach is very near and the dogs are very friendly. There is also a wonderful racoon.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

569995458.name: Amazing organization. Please donate if you can
569995458.author: a TripAdvisor user
569995458.reviewBody: Walked three dogs with my family today.One could not walk well so she got to be pulled to the beach in her wagon,she was so happy to play in the soft sand.This was a great experience and plan on doing it every day were here if possible.All the people that volunteered there were great and very grateful for any help you can give them.If your a animal lover this is a must

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

568440634.name: A Wonderful Place to Visit
568440634.author: a TripAdvisor user
568440634.reviewBody: As I walked through the gates I was greeted by several dogs, a few who had been hit by golf carts or trucks and couldn\u2019t walk, but they were happy to say hello and well cared for in this haven for animals. There were two litters of sweet puppies, a gentle raccoon, several old, chilling dogs and a few birds. Please share some love with these critters and get some love back while you\u2019re on holiday, and leave a donation if you can. If everyone left a little (or more) the refuge could increase their services for these kind beings who can\u2019t help themselves.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

566164022.name: Incredible!  Please help if you can!
566164022.author: a TripAdvisor user
566164022.reviewBody: These people are amazing and always in need of funds and donations.  I was so happy to hear about this place before I left the states.  I brought a bunch of leashes and flea/tick medication.   Isla Holbox is lucky to have these people!  Stop by, walk the dogs, leave a donation.  Love this!  :)

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

565927397.name: Support Refugio Holbox
565927397.author: a TripAdvisor user
565927397.reviewBody: It was one of my birthday wishes to visit the refuge and it was amazing! I got to snuggle with puppies and support a local charity organization. You can also walk dogs on the beach and meet the resident raccoon (Ernesto)! Great stop on our visit to Holbox

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

562809510.name: Full of admiration for this organization
562809510.author: a TripAdvisor user
562809510.reviewBody: The vets and volunteers are so dedicated in promoting animal well being and it was lovely to see the dogs of Holbox being so well cared for and happy. if you like dogs this is the place to be , owners are responsible the dogs are good natured and the island self policing in the way dogs are free to spread love and fun . a very inspiring place to visit .

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

560279113.name: I felt the love and passion!
560279113.author: a TripAdvisor user
560279113.reviewBody: Wonderful people! So many people come by and walk dogs every day. An amazing experience just to visit!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

556225806.name: Love Refugio Holbox
556225806.author: a TripAdvisor user
556225806.reviewBody: Wonderful and very much needed organization. They are doing wonderful work and provide free spay/neuter services not only on Holbox but also on the mainland. Cats and dogs are available for adoption and they said many of the dogs do get adopted by island visitors but rarely does anyone adopt a cat:(. They also do wildlife rehabilitation. Please stop and visit; donate and/or they also have volunteer opportunities.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

555968189.name: Such a great place
555968189.author: a TripAdvisor user
555968189.reviewBody: I walked dogs every day for a week and I wish I could just live here and work for them. It is a volunteer-run operation (best I can tell) and they do so much for all these animals that the least I could do was pitch in some of my time. I strongly urge anyone who loves animals to visit and make a donation -money or time. You can hang out as long as you want, play with the dogs and cats and raccoons and you can rest assured that the animals will be eternally grateful for the attention. Go!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

549832644.name: So Sweet!
549832644.author: a TripAdvisor user
549832644.reviewBody: We loved this visit.  The animals were so sweet and eager to be petted.  We loved the raccoon.  It was so funny how everybody got along and played together.  Animal lovers will love this visit.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

541038578.name: Everyone should stop here and make a donation.
541038578.author: a TripAdvisor user
541038578.reviewBody: We stopped here only for a few minutes and met the owner and she was amazing. All animals living together with no issues.

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

533536031.name: PLEASE VISIT AND DONATE!
533536031.author: a TripAdvisor user
533536031.reviewBody: While it has been several months since our visit, we were thrilled to stumble upon the local animal shelter. We had seen it on a map and found it while bicycling around town. As others have expressed, it is a labor of love there. Whatever support can be given, they kindly welcome it. We plan to return to Holbox next year and will make it a point to be there for dog walking, as we miss our own furry family while away. What a great idea!

address.streetAddress: Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell 1 Av. Pedro Joaquin Coldwell & Calle Tintorera

509264815.name: Wonderful place where find love
509264815.author: a TripAdvisor user
509264815.reviewBody:
I and my boyfriend went  twice to see how this people take care of dogs cats and wild animals of holbox and nearby towns.
Love is first; there are many dogs who need help; 2 veterinaries, there is also Venanzio a nice mapache who live there.
We gave a donation...if other tourist will go there it could be important for saving dogs and wild fauna of the island.
You can also bring the dogs to the beach for a walk.
Hightly recommended!

493520424.name: An unexpectedly lovely afternoon
493520424.author: a TripAdvisor user
493520424.reviewBody:
My boyfriend and I visited Holbox last year and stayed at Tribu. One morning we noticed that the daily activity board said "walk local shelter dogs, 4pm." We loved this idea, so we signed up. 

At 4pm we met the others who wanted to go and walked over to the refugio. It doesn't look like much and would be easy to miss, but what a great experience this was. We were welcomed in by Morelia, the owner, and her small staff. After a quick tour and some pictures of the resident coatis, we went to greet the dogs. Some of them weren't in great condition, and that was hard for me to see, but I remembered that this was the very reason for the shelter: to rehabilitate them and nurse them back to health. 

Despite their condition, the dogs were thrilled to see us and excited for a walk and all the attention. It was great to take them out and give them some one-on-one attention. We returned after about 45 mins and took them into the feeding area, where they were given their dinner.

Since returning from this trip, I've recommended that anyone visiting Holbox venture over to the shelter. My mom recently went and had a similarly great experience. I've also been volunteering with them to develop a new website and hopefully forge connections on the island so that more visitors will be aware of the shelter's existence.

While not your typical tourist stop, it's really lovely to be able to see the work Morelia is doing and learn about the need for a shelter and animal education in the area. Donations are always appreciated, and I would really recommend a visit to the shelter on your next Holbox trip!
